text:
Best sushi place in Gilbert.

yes even over Otaku and Blue Wasabi
Will Kreitler, my good pal recommended this place, and I'm sure glad he did. Very tasty vegas rolls and good happy hour. The staff is friendly and professional. Highly recommend.
Great service and food.  Have ordered numerous times for pick up, but have to say eating in is even better.

Was hoping this would be a good sushi place, but was anything but good. Sushi took an hour to come out and was subpar. No refills on our water the whole time and they charged us full price for sushi that was on their happy hour menu, I guess they don't even know their own happy hours. I've been to quite a few sushi restaurants in the valley and this is by far the worst place. ?????????

This is a great place for both traditional sushi and unique fusion roles.

I don't quite understand why this place is hardly ever busy - I can only figure it's the location that fails to draw a crowd.  The food is great and the chefs and wait staff are always super friendly.   Prices are about average and they have recently incorporated some great lunch combos.

This has been our recent sushi spot! fresh fish (love the nigiri and the baked scallop roll)... great dishes from
the kitchen (killer chicken wings appetizer and yummy yakisoba)! Great service and fast sushi prep! Our weekly sushi fix is satisfied x 10 at Sushi Ave

I made a pick up order due to a time crunch. The hostess, Hannah,is the sweetest thing I've ever spoken to. Very accommodating and pleasant! She made sure that our order was perfect. 

I work in customer service and it's really awesome to experience others 'actually' doing and enjoying their job. I'm bringing my fianc√© back to dine-in as soon as we get the time!
My wife and I come here all the time and LOVE IT. We are picky sushi eaters and this is one of our favorites in Gilbert. Great food and service!

This little restaurant is off the chain! My gal pals and I made it a tradition to stop by for happy hour most weeks! Their rolls are fresh and the edamame nice and warm always :) We will never go anywhere else for sushi!!!!!!!! capital L-O-V-E LOVE IT. 
Now THAT is what I call............Sushi. 

P.s. Love the dessert orange :^)

This is a great Sushi restaurant with an excellent happy hour.  The rolls are well priced and we prefer to drive out to this location even though we have several other gilbert Sushi locations closer to our home.  My favorite rolls are the Pink Lady Roll, Spicy Crab and the Philly Roll.  The service is always very good and the price is just right.  Give it a try, you won't be disappointed.

Nicole S. has said it all.  

Tonight we had an added attraction,  the entertainment was watching the sushi chef smell the fish in view of the dinners.  Maybe that should have been done in the back before they opened for dinner.
We've been eating awesome sushi at a great price at Sushi Avenue for about a year now. It's become a regular stop for my wife and I. We love the atmosphere and service, and the value is unbeatable.
Place is awesome happy hour is great my daughter loves the udon noodle amazing service hannah was our server and she was amazing
Finally got over to check this place out. So excited to have good sushi and friendly service so close to home...we will be back!
This is by far my favorite sushi place I've ever been to. For happy hour their rolls as low as $3 and they are amaaaazing. It's a way chill atmosphere too. GO HERE!!

I've been twice and have been very impressed both times. The sushi is very fresh and I really appreciate how the rolls are cut. This sounds weird, right? Stay with me. Usually I feel like I'm going to choke on a piece of sushi because it is so large and I don't really enjoy the flavors as much as I would if the pieces were manageable. Alright... go ahead with the "that's what she said" joke. This review is asking for it. 

But this restaurant is fast becoming my favorite for sushi. The service I have experienced has always been top notch. 

Can't wait to go back for Sushi Tuesdays!

I used to love Kanpai - great prices, quality food, and an excellent staff. I don't know if it was sold or what they are doing but 'Sushi Ave' is now treading on the classic and established Kanpai name. Prices are higher, portions are smaller, and the quality of the fish is horrid. All my old favorites are gone and the recipes have all changed. 

I'm really disappointed to lose one of my favorite sushi bars in Phoenix, but as one of the new staff said 'we have to change it up'. Sadly I won't be back and I don't suggest they be allowed to continue to tarnish such an established name.

Alright, I would have given this place  a 5 star rating, because to date this is the best sushi I have had!
Now I'm not just some beginner in the sushi world, Im well traveled I have had sushi across the country a few times in Canada and allot in Australia. This place combines Great service with Good prices and personable people. you wont regret it if you eat here! get something you have never tried before and sit at the bar talk to the chefs they are really cool! ask for the "Real Wasabi" and order a hand roll and the mackerel.
Magnificent!

ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. I come here every Friday, I have for the past 2 months and I'm not going to stop. Inviting atmosphere, friendly employees, great sushi and good prices. I really love how it's so easy to unwind here after a long work week, this place makes me appreciate treating myself. Great start to a weekend and the perfect environment to bring your family or friends. Highly recommended. 5 stars.

Yum!!!! I had a total craving for sushi and found this place had good reviews here on yelp.  I was skeptical as I usually have sushi at fancy Scottsdale places, but seeing as it was so close to home, I gave it awhirl.  The restaurant boasts an "A" rating and though it was was super simple inside, the sushi tasted so fresh and was amazing.  I will be back soon and absolutely recommend!
Really awesome sushi with a cool thing they have going on there. We enjoy this place greatly and will come back I'm sure many times! Great wife selection of sushi!

Cheap sushi no longer means you'll get sick! This place has some amazing deals and some amazing sushi. You can't go wrong. The service, ambiance, taste, and speed of getting food is all top notch and I will come here again and again. They are easily as good as the bigger sushi places downtown that take twice as long to drive to and cost twice as much

Finally found a place I can grab sushi that doesn't cost a fortune... tastes so fresh and has a relaxed atmosphere. We will definitely be back. Service was just a little slow but as long as I plan for the time than no worries.. as I said before Will definitely be back

Our first time going to sushi ave we were hesitant about trying a new sushi place. But overall the food was amazing, the service was good and it had a great environment. Small restaurant, good for talking and socializing. At the end of our dinner our server brought over a little complimentary dessert, it was a small orange drizzled with chocolate sauce and topped with whip cream. It was simple but delicious. We enjoyed our dinner and recommended this restaurant.

My favorite sushi around. Staff is friendly food is fresh and DELISH! I love that they have the fresh wasabi-not everyone does. Just getting Salmon and Tuna sushimi tonight with fresh wasabi yet I usually get the seaweed salad. It's INCREDIBLY delicious! I love their rolls and their calamari as well. They have a nice selection of sakes as well!
Sushi was ok service was horrendous. Went in there with our kids and the lady was very annoyed. Will never go back.

Ate at this place today.  The food was mediocre at best.  I got a salmon roll, yellow tail roll and another type of roll that I can't remember the name of right now since I have dementia already stetting in.  Anyways, each roll was not cut correctly - some pieces were very big and some pieces had where the rice was not entirely covered by seaweed because of the improper cutting.   The seaweed also tasted very unfresh. 

In addition, I ordered some three appetizers.   The first, appetizer was some roasted peppers.  Unfortunately, the description in the menu didn't match the taste.  The peppers were mostly tough and didn't have much taste, surprising for a pepper.  The second appetizer was a yellow tail collar.  The collar had an off taste indicating it was not fresh.  

However, it wasn't all bad.  I got some tofu that was deep fried that was decent.  The only problem is that the tofu lost most of the crunchiness because it was swimming in some sauce.

Best sushi restaurant around! They also have wonderful orange chicken and yaki soba. They have great happy hour specials and their sushi is always fresh. If you like sake, try their raspberry sake, it's wonderful, lightly sweet and just right. You won't be disappointed with this little gem in Gilbert.
Great food and great service every time we stop by. This is our go to date night spot. Happy Hour is fantastic!
This is one of my favorite sushi restaurants! They're baked rolls are amazing!!! And they have infused sake which is fantastic!! I love the variety and their service is fast!! Worth the drive :)
It is easy to miss this spot since it's tucked in a strip mall, but the staff are friendly and the sushi is tasty. A great alternative to the overcrowded, overpriced Scottsdale sushi bars.

Ever since our fave sushi spot jumped the shark, we've been on the hunt for another gem!  We decided on a lazy Monday night to finally try this place out.  We walked in and saw all the little bottles with regular customer's chop sticks- super nice touch!  The place is small and intimate! A few TVs and bar seating where you can watch the sushi chef prepare the rolls.  We ordered potstickers, Alaska roll, shrimp tempura roll, salmon sashimi, spicy tuna and salmon rolls.  The potstickers took a while to come out, but they were worth the wait.  The sashimi was excellent and super fresh!  They lose some points on presentation of the tempura and spicy rolls, as they were all jumbled together on a plate; but the Alaska, which came out a good 10 minutes later was like picture perfect, complete with an expertly carved lemon! That roll stole the show.  Delicious!  The only thing that wasn't up to par was the tempura roll. It just didn't have any flavor.  And the crab mix inside, with the yum yum sauce was a bit off putting and made the roll mushy.  So if you're a real sushi lover who doesn't wuss out and order tempura rolls, you'll love this place!  We will certainly go again, and proceed to order some of the freshest sushi in town!

Sushi Ave ranks as not only one of the best sushi spots in town, but their happy hour makes them the best deal as well. All of their sushi is great, but I especially love the Ultimate California. If you're more into your fish, their sashimi is always fresh and it's only 6 bucks during happy hour. Happy hour lasts until 7, but they also have lunch happy hour. Lastly, they throw in an orange dessert for free! Yummy!

I'm not sure if we just came in on an off day or what. Friday happy hour... Decent happy hour menu. We ordered a bunch of salmon nigiri and then a sashimi B plate. It was like $30 for 20 pieces of sashimi. We thought: yeah! Great deal! They do not have gluten free soy sauce. They don't give you any ginger. Wasabi paste was awful and stale tasting. The salmon nigiri was pretty great and we loved it, so we were so excited to try our sashimi plate. Ugh! The yellowtail was tough and dry, the salmon had a slimy white substance on it, the albacore was good but sliced so it was sinewy and not melt in your mouth like it is supposed to be. The whole plate was drenched in some kind of light brown liquid... Not really what I'm expecting when I order sashimi. Tataki, sure. But this liquid pooled in the middle of the plate and didn't really taste like anything. We did not finish our food, taking bites of this sub par fish grossed us out (we eat sashimi and nigiri weekly so this is not a new food to us). The plus side was the waitress was very nice and cheery. She didn't seem to notice we didn't finish our food. This place was a waste of $70... I do understand places have off days but I don't believe I will eat here again. The place is super dark so you can barely see what you're eating... Also the bathroom was pretty dirty for it being 3pm.

Me and my wife love sushi Ave its very family friendly with prices that don't rob your wallet..the environment is very calming and enjoyable the food well is AMAZING by far the best sushi I have had in Arizona it always taste fresh like being in California and right down the street from the fish market you can't get better than that... we have become regulars here so thank you to the sushi Ave family you all are doing a great job

This place is close to my house and has great quality sushi. Recently there was a Facebook group discussing best sushi in gilbert and half the people said sushi avenue. Everything is fresh and delicious!
The food was some of the best Sushi I have ever had. Got it in a groupon and was beyond thrilled. If you love sushi this will be your new spot. Hands down.

I've always known that this has been a "members' only" type of place where the regulars get astonishingly preferential treatment and everybody else is treated like aliens from another solar system dressed in Earthen 70s disco attire, but I never cared because the food was fresh, delicious, and of good quality.

But the last two times I was here, it was just unacceptable. Our party would order our food and see people seated and served who came in 30 minutes after we ordered. I don't mind "unfriendly" service (I really don't require a smile and dance from my servers), but it has become almost insulting.

Also, portions have lessened, I've noticed. The quality is still good, which is the reason for the two stars, but it seems that the management doesn't care to keep newish or infrequent customers. The chefs do care about the quality of food they serve to their customers, but they don't seem to care about their potential regular customers.
This is our favorite sushi restaurant!! We come all the time, and they have THE BEST happy hour deals! Great customer service and they bring out your food super fast! Definitely recommend!

My sister and I had lunch at Sushi Ave and had a fabulous experience.  My sister ordered the Bento Box with Teriyaki Beef and almost licked the box clean.  I ordered the Jalapeno Roll and Rainbow Roll and both were delicious.  The Jalapeno Roll with just a hint of crunch was amazing.  I am not from that area and will definitely go back when I am in town.

This place is really great! The happy hour menu is limited but there is enough variety to satisfy, and the pricing is affordable. Overall, it's one of my favorites in the area. This is "the spot" for my GF and I when we don't want to cook but don't want to break the bank. A hearty must try.

My favorite sushi place.  I go as often as I can. Certainly some dishes are better than others, but I have never been disappointed.  Some of my favorites are:  albacore tataki, spicy tuna roll, and anything with scallops.  Non-sushi food is also good: tempura, green lip mussels, agadashi tofu, and gyoza frequent my plate.  Full Japanese menu in addition to sushi.  Not sure if they have a full bar but beer, sake, and Japanese wine are available.

It can get packed during the dinner hour, especially on Friday and Saturday nights, so I mostly go for lunch.  Service is always good and friendly.
This was our first time at sushi ave. I thought took my boys and they loved it. We are gluten free in our house and our server and staff were very knowledgeable. We will be back!

Came here with my parents. We ordered the shrimp fried rice, agadashi tofu, sake kama (grilled salmon appetizer), coconut shrimp, a California roll, and a vegetarian roll. Everything tasted great! The fried rice was my favorite. And this was one of the best vegetarian rolls I've ever had. Not boring at all. My dad enjoyed the house sake with his food. Will be returning.
This place is great! Fruit flavored Sake, friendly staff, and prompt food. Happy Hour menu is great and served until 7pm!! Plus, you can get your own chopsticks and use them every time you come!

Sushi was mediocre. I do like their variety. Service was great. I just wish they'd work on one thing... My experience there was okay for my first time and the moment you step in to wash up its a nasty disappointment. I am huge on cleanliness and a restaurant should always have a clean restroom. If they can't maintain that for their customers and staff what's it to say about their kitchen? Just a thought. Not sure I'll ever go back. If they'd fix that issue it'd be a perfect little local spot.
Best Sushi in Phoenix hands down. Great place and great people.  We have been coming here all the time and it is always great food and great service.

Great little place that has the best Sushi chef!  I have to admit, I knew the sushi chef from a former restaurant and so we went there to check out his new place.  Get to know this guy and he'll take care of you!

I went here for the first time last week with a friend and the vibe is very laid back and relaxed.  Very clean and neat little place too.  We each ordered an appetizer- the mushrooms for me, the fried peppers for him.  The mushrooms were tasty, but the peppers were the best I'd ever had! 

We then each ordered a couple of rolls and then a sashimi appetizer.  I ordered the avocado roll, the eel roll and one other roll I can't remember.   I know they are kind of basic, but that's what really shows the quality of the ingredients.  The sashimi appetizer had several different types of sashimi and all the fish was fresh and simply, but nicely, presented. 

The prices were very reasonable for what we ordered as well.  

The little thing that was a big selling point, to me, about this place was the menu.  Everything was clearly pictured and had the roll ingredients for each roll.  For someone with food allergies and who is picky about my food combinations,  this was a BIG help for me!  This is also a big help to those not too familiar with sushi, but want to try something new.

All in all, a great experience.  I will definitely be back!

I love this place! It was my first time here and I'm so impressed with their sushi and roll selection as well as their lunch and dinner options! We got potstickers that were crispy and delicious! My mom got the fried rice with chicken and got a salad and miso soup included. The salad had a yummy soy sauce-like dressing which was so good! I got the traditional California Roll as well as a Tootsie Roll and they both were so good! Service was awesome! At the end, we got complementary dessert oranges. The waitress gave me one with honey, since I can't have whipped cream or chocolate - which is what my mom got on hers! My honey orange was delicious! I love everything about this place. Great vibes, great food, great service, and I can't wait to come back again!

This is a terrible place. Came here and ordered 4 rolls.  The first one came out,  the second came out 5 minutes later and then we sat for 30 minutes and still didn't see the third or fourth.  Mind you the last 2  were vegetables rolls... The easiest roll to make.  The service was terrible,  and the server had no idea what the food was that she was serving.  The sushi was just ok.  Don't waste your time!
Great food and service. Very nice waitress. Good atmosphere. Like to go for the happy hour specials.

So far so good. The people were nice and there is a free appetizer if you write a review. I haven't trIed any of the food yet so I'll be back after we eat something. For now I'm listening to my 11 year old daughter argue with her mom about how to find the area of a triangle. I may need a saki bomber.
The sushi here was great!  Service could have been better but the food definitely made up for it.

This place has excellent taste in sushi! They have the best chicken teriyaki roll that no other restaurant has come close to. The service is always great and friendly and the food is fresh and unique. 

Little tucked away restaurant with great food.
Great sushi.  But above N. Scottsdale prices!   Can't afford to eat sushi at these prices very often. Service was okay. Sushi chef was friendly and offered yummy suggestions.

Loved this place and their food but the last couple times I've been by, they have been very inattentive and even forgotten that they put in my order. This past time I came in with a drink so it didn't melt in my car and they were very rude about it when I clearly told them I wasn't drinking it as it would just be sitting inside instead of my 100 degree car. The food is good but the staff could be nicer

We love sushi ave! It's our go to place for sushi plus their happy hour is amazing! We love the Las Vegas roll and their simple creamy California roll! We had the Arizona roll tonight and it was for sure added to our top list! Love this place!

This place is great!!! Favorite sushi!! Love it, has a great happy hour!! My son's brought us here and we've been back twice.  The quality is fresh. Service is always superb....would recommend to other family members and friends. Jalape√±o roll is my favorite, but their all good.

Awesome people
Awesome food 
Never disappoints me whenever I come here!
This is my third time here this week 
Shoutout to the servers !  Heather & Hannah !
I feel like this place is definitely underrated 
More people should come here
Great prices, yummy sushi. I love their California crunch roll with eel sauce and their Hawaiian chicken.
Sushi Ave is a great spot for good sushi. The happy hour has excellent prices. The California crunch is my family's favorite! Their desert orange is a really nice touch too!

Sushi Ave has great, like their name says, sushi! I got salmon sushi as well as California rolls and they were both out of this world! The potstickers were awesome too! Great fast service and friendly servers... 10/10 would recommend!

I have been a customer of Sushi Ave for some time, I was upset that my friend sold the place and moved away. I was glad to see that most of the menu is still the same but the quality did fall at first.  I have been back a few times and the new owners are starting to win me over.  Some rolls are just about as I remember them but, some of the more specialty rolls that I  loved are not there yet. One of the things I do like that has not changed is the rolls are rolled smaller, not hard to eat, kind of bite sized.  The rolls are longer so you are not cheated and it makes it easier to eat 

Over all this is still my favorite place to go in the East Valley. Try the Arizona roll, it's not as good as it used to be but still very tasty.  

We miss you James

Apparently, the Tempe "Kampai" is a different restaurant from this one. But, I can't find the Kampai Mill Ave. spot on here.  So, if you are looking for info about the Kampai Tempe, here is my reviewAwesome place.  Had some low expectations because it is in a big space on Mill Ave., and the tile floors and bright light didn't scream quality.  But, that fish was outstanding!  I love a creative, spicy roll with lots of fish, and I have been missing that since Zen 32 closed (sob).  There was a lot of variety on the menu, and just the yellowtail shashimi was buttery, and perfect.  The sushi chefs were friendly, didn't hand us too many dishes too fast, and put made them in a pleasing order.  I think my favorite was the surf and turf roll (the beef slices finished off with a torch - nice touch!)  Happy hour pricing is fantastic.  And I found a new delight: seaweed salad.  Nice krinkly, poppy texture, great seasoning, plus some cucumbers thrown in.  I wish I loved closer!

Excellent service from Hannah and delicious food! Will return!

Great fish and it was incredibly fresh. I recommend the seaweed salad and specialty roll!
This is a great place to have sushi for lunch, Mon-Fri 11 AM to 2 PM happy hour, nice and quiet, sushi tastes fresh and rolls are creative, love it!!
Rolling tiger roll is the best sushi roll I've ever had. I have not had a bad sushi roll at this restaurant. You will enjoy it. Unique rolls and quality sushi.

I had a great dinner at Sushi Ave tonight with my family. Nice food and kind people. 
I would definitely visit again.

We're so lucky Sushi Ave is close to our house! Sushi is delicious and served quickly by friendly staff. Bento box lunch specials are a great deal and you get more than enough food.  Be sure to drop by for the happy hour deals too.
Tried Sushi Ave tonight, food is excellent! Hidden little place off Higley.  Service was also wonderful.  Will definitely back!

Just went here for lunch and tried the bento boxes and a couple of the specialty rolls.  Everything was very good.  The teriyaki beef was better than most I've tried.

Also, the decor was a perfect mix of dark wood, Japanese accents, and modern feel.  Will definitely be back, perhaps to try out the happy hour.
The sushi made by Mihwa was amazing! And the service was great from Colin. We'll definitely be back soon!

The Fall From Sushi Grace!! 
Kampai used to be my favorite sushi restraunt, there fish was very high quality and purchased fresh everyday. Now Kampai is simply meteocre, the new owners have completely changed the menu, sushi chefs, and the quality of fish has gone down drastically. Honestly I would not go back to Kampai now based on price alone, they are just to expensive for the low quality food that is served now. Less is definitely more as far as the old Kampai goes, their menu was simple and so were the ingrediants in the rolls. If you do choose to try out the downgraded Kampai I suggest the spicy tuna roll and the vegas roll, both are decent tasting. This sushi restraunt has nothing special to offer its consumers anymore. If you have been loyal to Kampai you will see how badly a mistake the original owners made when they decided to sell. Also Kampai is now open all the time so you can eat their crappy food almost anytime of the day now.
Really good food, great prices... you should try if you're looking for sushi in the east valley
Absolutely delicious!! Will definitely return!! The ponzu sauce is to die for and the fish is so fresh!! Thank you!!

I really really enjoyed this place. I went when they first opened so it was obviously not crowded, but the service was nice and the food was delicious. I ordered a bento box and my husband ordered a few different types of sushi. I devoured my food and ate most of his sushi. We ended up sticking to ordinary dishes and am so impressed I can't wait to try some of their other menu options.

Amazing sushi.. A little expensive but a great treat every now and then
We ordered the Las Vegas rolls and didn't expect the fried veggies to come with but they were an amazing treat with the rolls
The sushi was suprisingly fresh and tasty both times I went here! The prices are also very reasonable.

We are new to AZ and have tried several sushi places. We finally found our new home! My wife and I love this place! It has the best happy hour.  You can't go wrong with anything on the menu! Great decor, great food!
Ordered the Salmon teriyaki Bento box for lunch special and it was perfect! Always come back here for authentic japanese food..

Really a 3.5 rating.  Went on friday night and it  was about half full.  girlfriend and i sat at the bar. 

cons: 1. somehow they messed up our order and gave it to someone next to us, who ordered after us.  they figured it out and gave it  back to us   2.  I had to ask for ginger, which is pretty lame, and then they only gave us one btwn the two of us.  the ginger is also unusually sweet, as they marinate it a second time.  i just like the original, white, uncolored ginger.  3.  Ordered the pink lady roll, and i am still trying to figure out what the pink stuff on the outside of it

pros:  double spicy roll (spicy tuna inside and out), new york roll (spicy salmon and other stuff that is whole roll tempura fried), and salmon nigiri.  Salmon was awesome!  fatty, perfectly cut, and not old and dry.  the rolls aren't loaded with rice that make you feel stuffed and take away from flavor.

definitely i will go back to see how it goes a second time.  japanese gf made a good point that almost every roll has imitation crab which makes it lower quality and makes rolls look bigger.
Good sushi. Good service. Great casual place to just have some sushi.  Nothing really special but like a good staple.
Las Vegas, new york and dynamite rolls delicious.  Very reasonable happy hour prices and from 4-7 so great time frame. Great sushi will come again

Best sushi around! Fast, friendly and great quality.  Our favorite part is you get to pick your own chop sticks, name them, put them in a little jar and then pick them off a shelf on your way in-every time.

I had eyeballed this place many many times as I drove down Bell road. This past week I was so tired and hungry, I decided to stop in finally. 

The interior isn't anything special. The whole dining area is a sea of teal and warm wood. The dining room wasn't too full the night we went there- which is probably a good thing, as the service was kinda slow. 

We ended up getting Teriyaki Chicken and Tempura Udon. Mainly because there wasn't much else on the menu that I could find to eat. Most of the non-sushi items were deep fried in some manner, or they were boring teriyaki. My companion normally gets sushi, but he told me that there was a bunch of un-needed and weird crap in each of the rolls. And he didn't want to spend money on something he'd hate. 

His teriyaki chicken came with miso and salad. The miso was rather mild, for better or worse. The salad had too much dressing on it, imo. The dressing itself was okay, but nothing exceptional. 

When the main courses came out the chicken was dry, the sauce was thin and tasted like slightly sweetened soy. My udon wasn't bad (surprise) but it had spice in it (something not mentioned in the menu) and I couldn't really enjoy the broth- as my mouth caught on fire (I'm a wuss). If you're into that sort of thing, the udon is probably very good. I did like the shrimp- it was firm and tasty. The noodles were done to a fairly nice texture. 

Overall, Kampai seems to be a good place for sushi, but I wouldn't recommend it for anyone who wants something that is not sushi.
This is my favorite place for sushi! Their lunch menu is also really cheap with lots of good rolls to choose from! I have never had a bad roll here!
Awesome.  Excellent food and service.  Looking forward to more visits.  Very extensive menu.  Exceptionally clean and pleasant.

I had never tried sushi until I moved to the Valley 3 years ago. I since have become a huge fan. This very restaurant played a huge role in this. Every time I eat there I get about 5 rolls for my girlfriend and I to share. It fills you up and it doesn't break the bank in the process. The atmosphere is very nice as well, dark modern furnishings throughout. The owners are so nice there as well, welcoming each customer with a genuine smile and greeting. Overall: Great place to grab some sushi.

For my purpose, quick tasty sushi at a great price, this place is perfect. Service is fine. It's not somewhere I would take people to impress them with the ambiance, which is nice if not upscale, but I come here after work all the time when I can hit happy hour which is mon-fri 3-6 and 8-close.

I likethis pace becuase it is kind of like mom and pop place I frequented in Tokyo a few years back....

However, the sushi is just OK and a little pricey considering the ambience.   The service is prompt and efficient. 

We shared a sushi platter that was a liitle flat taste wise and even the unagi tasted a little off.... 

On the plus side, they are open on Sundays!   That is the reason we ended up there as they are WAY down our list of places to frequent for sushi....

I have been here on multiple occasions... it is definitely NOT my first choice but not a bed second if you are in the area...
What a gem!! Can't believe I have never been here. Great food, great price, great service. TRIFECTA!

DO NOT LISTEN TO ALL THESE HATERS WHO MISS THE OLD MANAGEMENT!!!  The change could not have been better in my opinion!  Under the old management, it felt really tense, awkward, and unfriendly.  The sushi chefs, especially the older man, would simply not talk with anyone at the sushi bar seating; you basically had to FORCE conversation on them to fill the uncomfortable silence, provided you were outgoing enough to break the ice.  Every time you needed something, it was unclear who to ask, and you felt like a pest.  The selection of food items was super limited and weak; especially the rolls.  There was only a short list of rolls, and most of them were kinda lackluster.  I recently decided to give the place another try, and was pleasantly surprised....no, BLOWN AWAY by the new management!  They were playing rock music, a nice lady greeted me, and the new sushi chef "Kasper" is literally the COOLEST AND MOST INTERESTING CHEF I HAVE EVER TALKED TO!!!  We hit it off so well right away that he made me an amazing custom roll that he let me design myself, and we quickly became Facebook friends. He'll treat you so well and make you feel so comfortable that you'll want to leave him a much-deserved big tip.  The menu has been expanded to include a huge selection of awesome, tasty, creative, modern rolls.  Trust me, I eat a lot of sushi and have tried most places in the valley, and you won't get this kind of low-key, one-on-one experience anywhere else!  This place now RULES!!!!!!!

I love Sushi Ave. They have always delivered on amazing sushi. Their rainbow roll is awesome and their staff is great. The are quick and their food is delicious. We will definitely continue to go. Their prices are average for sushi

Supper amaizing sushi. Staff was friendly and helpful.  The chef answered all our questions and made the sushi right in front of us. The price is affordable and the atmosphere is fresh.  Best sushi in the area.

Yes, the service here is still bad, bad, bad. But it is the closest sushi place to my house and the quality of the food is pretty good. So what I do now is order take-out, and show up 10 minutes after they say it will be ready. Sometimes I still wait a few minutes. But if you are prepared for this it's not too bad because the sushi is good. And the staff is very friendly. I had to bump this review up to 3 stars because the quality of sushi. If they would work on their service I would bump it up to a 4 star review.
Best sushi around! I highly recommend the Arizona roll, you will not be let down! Great service with very friendly staff. Happy Hour specials are a good deal and very filling

The rolls here are amazing! We made it here for happy hour and tried a number of different rolls. Each one was incredible! Quality ingredients, quality facilities, and plenty of variety. Great service and a clean, inviting ambience to go with it. I eat a lot of sushi and can highly recommend this place!
Horrible service and this use to be the place we chose over everything in Phoenix. What happened.? Please hire smarter.

A little hole in the wall behind the Whataburger.  I stopped in on a whim and have gone back again and again.  They have a 1/2 price menu 4-7pm Monday-Saturday that I'm working through and their full price fare is still a great value.  Try the cucumber salad.

This is easily the best sushi I've found out here. My wife and I frequently visit and are never disappointed. The service is excellent and the sushi is well-prepared and tastes great! You really can't go wrong here.

We love this place.  We found it by chance about 5 years ago and it is now our go-to date night escape.  We love the sushi (especially sashimi) and the rolls (Mango Roll and King Kong!!).  We also occasionally enjoy some of their Korean food (Kim chee or Galbi).  After the meal they serve a small orange and whip cream dessert that finishes thing off just right!

If you enjoy well prepared, fresh Sushi..do not go here.  For lunch, I stopped in on a Saturday at 1:30, and only one table besides mine in the place. I had the lunch special. Miso soup was good. Only thing that stood out.Dressing on salad was good, but it was a miniature salad in a tea cup with TONS of spines of romaine. Chose sashimi (NO SUBSTITUTIONS in caps on the menu) with one roll..I chose eel and cucumber.  The fish was cut to different thickness for EVERY cut. LOUSY. The snapper was good and cut wafer thin, tuna was stringy and cut like a square, the salmon was the worst and cut very thick and like a square.  the The roll was loose and fell apart. Eel was MINUTE. I'm serious, it was a nibble of a 1/4 inch by 1/4 inch of eel.  If you don't have eel TAKE IT THE FREAK OFF THE MENU. Also, I've tasted many eel rolls in my time. This...not fresh and the sauce that accompanies was WAY too sweet.  They have Ginger and wasabi at the table when you walk in. I find this weird and what is to say that someone doesn't stick their chopsticks in there after it's been in their mouth?  UNSANITARY.  The wasabi was VERY bland. NO KICK. I inquired when the waitress finally came to check on me and she said "Would you like FRESH WASABI?  I was thinking WTF am I eating 4 day old stuff?  Ick. They had METAL CHOP STICKS. Again WTF? Too cheap for wood sticks. Not cool. Not natural. When they bring you your check they served a slice of orange which is traditional..BUT they SLATHERED it with some fake chocolate sauce and STALE, not natural WHIPPED CREAM. Just GROSS.  Also the place was SWEATY hot. Just BAD and I wished I'd saved my hard earned cash. The ginger and wasabi on the table should have alerted me to leave, but I was hungry. Sent back the dish with some fish still on it.Will not return. EVER.
This is a very good happy hour sushi bar.Their sushi is better than most. Service is Good most of the time if it is the owners they are awesome.
Bento box is fantastic. My wife loved the teriyaki chicken. California roll was great. Crunchy pot stockers. Yummy orange dessert!
What used to be arguably the best sushi place in PHX is now one of, if not the, worst. So sad to lose the old Kampai.
Very good sushi and the service has always been responsive. I really enjoy the atmosphere.
Fantastic food!! I love the happy hour menu always great options. Wonderful staff feel super welcome. Definitely one of my favorite local sushi spots, always pleased.

We are new to the area and we were so happy to have found Sushi Ave. As you walk into this neighborhood restaurant, you can't help but notice the wall lined with customers' personal chopsticks. The music playing added to the atmosphere. The service was great, the food was tasty, and it will become one of our regular hangouts.

I looooove me some good, cheap sushi and this is the place to get it! It's better than good! My friends and I have come here quite a few times and we enjoy it every time. Great fast and friendly customer service, and tasty sake bombs! I'll continue to bring my friends here for our sushi dates. Thank you sushi Ave staff! :)

If your in the East Valley this is the sushi place you have to go to! They have nice staff, and the best tasting sushi I've ever had! My favorite roll is the Rolling tiger! And they have a great Vegas roll to! 

Anyway sushi ave is a great place to go and you won't spend to much either, We usually get about 4 rolls for 20 buck in happy hour plus because we frequent so often we have our own chopsticks! #swag #sushi4days

My fiance and I visited this spot on a Thursday evening around 8pm. Based on reviews, we were expecting a very positive experience. Although it was a little late for dinner there were still a handful of parties in the restaurant and many sounded like regulars...a good sign in our eyes.

We were seated in our requested booth and our server was very pleasant as she immediately brought us our tea/waters and took our order. We ordered 3 rolls and sashimi between us and an order of vegetable tempura. 

The fish was of good quality and tasted very fresh. The balance of flavor in each roll was just right. One thing we noticed was how loosely the sushi was rolled. Each piece had the tendency to fall apart and trust, we know how to use chopsticks. The sushi just wasn't rolled up very tightly. Not a bad thing per se since it didn't affect the taste at all but just a tad annoying. 

The other thing we noticed was how long it took for our sushi to arrive. Again, not necessarily a bad thing because we were enjoying dinner together but it still would have been nice to have some of our sushi come out earlier than the others so that we could eat and converse at the same time.

All in all, it's a quaint restaurant with good tasting sushi and a nice vibe. If we are in the area again and craving sushi we would probably go back.
Great place! Delicious sushi and friendly service. LOVE spicy tuna with avocado and philly cheese, highly recommend.

Sushi Ave is fantastic, I highly recommend their happy hour. Cheap beers, great selection of appetizers and rolls, a super friendly atmosphere and it's super delicious. We plan on making this our go-to sushi place.
We have always gotten good service, they have a great selection of sushi, and all day everyday happy hour!! This is the spot.

This place is nestled in a little strip mall next to AMF. The happy hour menu is unbelievable, great prices and the sushi is always fresh. Get here before 7 and it's all good!!! Sake bomber is a screaming deal too
Our favorite local sushi restaurant. Great service from  walk-in till end. Love going for Happy Hour. Very reasonably priced.

We ordered the special called the over the Rainbow roll. It was amazing! Apparently it can be ordered any time but it is not on the menu. Same for all of the weekly specials. Service was friendly, the tuna poke was really fresh and tasty. This was our first time here but will definitely be back. Plus they have happy hour from 8 until close.
Love sushi here. We will come back soon :) my boyfriend really loves it and now it will be our favorite sushi place. Keep finding more kinds of good food here. The service is so good.

Food was delicious and the prices are reasonable. My fianc√© and I came in on a Friday afternoon for lunch and it was not noisy. Not a lot of people, but don't let that fool you. This place is very much worth trying.

TERRIBLE!!! I got food poisoning from the sushi last week! I just moved here and literally searched quite a few sushi restaurants and chose this place due to their reviews. Sadly, the next day and 4 days continuing with only what you could imagine from food poisoning! (will not get graphic). They might not store their Sushi how it should be stored or get it fresh. (Not sure). It was quite dry and they messed up when asking for soy paper. We took the Sushi to go and my boyfriend ordered an item with shrimp. Also, when he arrived to pick up our order they said they were out of the item he ordered. Instead of offering to make him something else they were quick to make him pay and send him on his way.
No one can top fresh just caught sushi, served up on the sea wall in Okinawa with a bottle of Kirin.  HOWEVER, Sushi Ave is pretty close.  Smaller scale than most, cozy.  Great selection.

We have been coming to this place for many years , this place is one the best restaurant & trust me I have tried many japanese reastuants around State and outside U.S.A , all rolls are fresh,high quality, not too dry , not too small size

Staff is very friendly & good service 
Reasonal price for food you get
Solid sushi.  Great and friendly service.  Their happy hour deals are top notch, so many great deals.  Would recommend to everyone.

Does it taste good? Yes. Is it good sushi? Not really. Too much sauce/creams and deep fried items. Maybe we just ordered the wrong things because it didn't taste fresh the way sushi should. There's better places out there.

We usually frequent with this place once or twice a month food is good but the service is not.
The servers never refill your drinks,
Never check on you.
They take your order and vanish.
We loved the food so we kept going anyway and the prices are great for happy hour.
But we went there tonight and waited 45 minutes for our food in an in uncrowded restaurant.
They said they had a huge to go order when we asked .
We wanted to talk to the manager and he or she wouldn't come out for  couple mins and talk to us.
She told the server to task us if we could wait 15 more
Minutes to speak to her or him.
Thought that was kind of lame.
We won't go back there ever again.

I regularly go to this place for lunch with a group of co-workers. We usually get there around 11:30 a.m.  I am always amazed that this location is never busy. 

This is one of my favorite locations in town. I can't say that I have ever had bad food during my visits. 

Again, today, 5 of the guys went in for lunch. Ordered seveal orders of sashimi, nigiri, and about 6 rolls.  All tasted very good.  We were also served two complimentary orders of pot stickers.  I pretty sure because of the slow service. 

My favorite is the Hawaian Role and Samurai Roll.  The Jalapeno Role is also good. 

My only complaint was that the food prep was a little slow. There was only one sushi chef and she clearly had a hard time keeping up with order. Now, I can understand if the place was packed, but when you are the only group in the restaurant, I would think the roles would come flying out!!!  Getting there at 11:00 a.m. we did not get out until almost 12:30 p.m.  A little too long for the only group in the place. 

Reading prior reviews, I learned that the place is under new management.  And it was a different chef behind the bar than the person from previous visit.  So maybe we are still developing skills. 

Will continue to visit. Food has always been good regardless owner.  Don't always want to spend 1 1/2 hour for lunch.

Would be 5 Stars.  But due to slower service today, taking away one star...

This place is amazing for their happy hour. The dynamite roll is on the happy hour menu and it is probably just about the most amazing sushi roll I've ever tasted in my life.  Not to mention the inside of this place is adorable and the staff is friendly as ever :) The happy hour has some great rolls on it and it's a good price, plus I saw they have happy hour all day during the summer! Cheap sushi that's good is always a great find!
First time visiting and we are very impressed with the food, service and atmosphere. Happy Hour has good prices. We'll be back soon!

We have been going there for 14 years! Uki son the owner was an amazing chef with the finest quality of sushi, amazing authentic rolls, like the Kampai roll, tgeir albacore tataki with their special sauce is to die for. The muscles with its own authentic taste was amazing! Now under new ownership and the quality of sushi decreased and its noticeable significantly, we gave it a 4 time try with the new owner BUT finally stopped wasting our money!!! The sushi chef drank and ate behind the counter while making sushi, did not wash his hands and it disgusted me! I WILL NEVER GO BACK AND I WANT TO LET OTHERS KNOW!!! Dont waste your $$$$
Place is clean. Ambience is good, and music is soothing. There is a tv on the wall for entertainment. Food is great, service is quick.

My Husband and I found Kampai after looking on the internet for exceptional Sushi places in the valley. From the outside, it looks like a hole-in-the-wall place not to be remembered, however that is certainly not the case here. After being dissapointed by every other place, we quickly discovered that KAMPAI IS THE BEST SUSHI IN ARIZONA!!! 
MY husband and I went there the whole time I was pregnant (I had Cal. Rolls and other cooked rolls for those of you whose mouths dropped when I said that) and every time we came in they asked how I was doing and talked to us like they were our best friends (And I do consider them our friends), anywho, when my son was born and we brought him in for the first time, all of the chefs came out from around the bar to look at him and meet him. We have taken him there alot since he was born (over 2 years now) and we have never had an issue with him and THEY ARE GREAT WITH KIDS!!! AJI, Uki, EJ, And Anthony are amazing and the sushi is out of this world. They are truely rivaled by none, Anytime my husband and I go to a sushi restaurant (even in New York and San Diego) we can never find a better Sushi Place than KAMPAI!!!

I have eaten here a few times since my original review. The staff is always friendly (Hannah is super awesome), and most (if not all) of the food I've had since my last review has been above average (good to great, depending on the item). It seems that I simply ordered the wrong menu items on my first visit (I haven't tried the yakisoba again, but that doesn't really seem to be "the thing" to eat here anyway; stick to the sushi). The Dynamite roll is great, my new favorite.

If you or the person you take out knows and loves authentic & very fresh sushi at very reasonable prices then this is the place to go. The chefs behind the bar speak Japanese and not Spanish. While they don't do alot of fancy custom "Americanized" rolls like some Scottsdale douche was complaining about, their sashimi is amazing! Try the Toro "fatty" tuna and the seared tataki is the best I've ever had (Over 80 diff sushi places coast to coast)
 
Of all the places I've ever had sushi if I could only pick one to eat at on a regular basis then Kampai would be that choice hands down.
 
When I do out on a date this is one of my top choices of places to eat.

We live close to Sushi Avenue and discovered it not long after it opened and have been regulars ever since. It's small, quiet and serves terrific sushi. The service is great and the staff is very friendly.

This place has a great happy hour to go along with their well made sushi. The sushi is an excellent value. Don't be fooled by the auto parts store nearby, this is a nice joint once you step inside. Give this place a try, you can't go wrong with any of the menu options. Who says you can't have sushi in Arizona?!

Great sushi!!
Great service !!
Try the Phoenix Suns Roll 
The Ultimate Shrimp Roll
The Tuna tataki Roll

I really can't remember what I got here several years ago, but I met up here with my cousin with our dates and we were the only ones getting the sushi, which was some of the first I ever had and got me into liking sushi. I remember it being good.

I've been here several times and the food has always been wonderful.  Love their unique Southwest Salmon Roll!  Service is uneven (excellent last visit, though not always), but it's worth tolerating for the great food.

This is an excellent sushi bar and so friendly. It may not be surprised busy during the day every day but it makes it so much intimate. The large selection of food is amazing and they are always quick on their to-go orders either by phone, in-person,'or through yelp takeout. They will even call if something comes up. Definitely a must try!
Great service and awesome lunch specials. Their Jalape√±o Roll is my all time fav! Also try the dynamite roll, it will blow your mind... see what I did there? Sushi Ave customer for life!

We've eaten here for take out once before and really liked it, but tonight was our first night dining in. I got two fried Philly rolls, and my husband got a teriyaki honey spicy chicken entree, with some edamame and miso soup on the side. It was all really good and decently priced! I was going to take a picture but I ate it too fast.  I also just found out they have a great happy hour menu for both lunch and dinner times. We'll be coming back here again for sure!

One of our favorite sushi restaurants in Phoenix!  they have a great happy hour and lunch deals! The salmon is particularly delicious and always tastes very fresh.  And my daughter really loves that you can pick out personal chopsticks.  Great place.
Really great sushi. I'm an avid sushi lover from LA and didn't expect to find great sushi all the way out here but it was really great and the sushi chef was extremely friendly.

I came here after reading a few reviews and also since I am currently living about two blocks away.  When I walked in, I was surprised to see a very small crowd seated at the tables (which is a good sign in a way).  The main crowd was seated at the sushi bar.  So, I sat down at the far left seat where a "local" immediately asked me: "Hey man, do you come here a lot?"  Of course I answered "no" and told him this was my first time.  A grin immediately overcame his face and he proceeded with "suggesting" to me what to order.  Typically I don't like it when folks insist on eating what THEY eat.  However, this guy seemed so enthusiastic for me to try FLOUNDER and a SCALLOP that I could not say no.  As I waited for my food to come - the local INSISTED I try some of his freshly ordered makeral - which he insisted I try to eat some of the "bones" from his dish.  Of course I didn't want to insult him - so I ate the bones and smiled as I chewed.  Actually, it was not that bad.  The servers were nice and the chefs were fast and accomodating to my  requests of spiciness as far as the tuna HANDROLL was concerned.  I will probably come back to this place.  It was made clear to me that every single person sitting at the bar was a patron of not less than 5 years.  That IS a good sign of a good sushi place!!

Very disappointed. Got the spicy garlic tuna roll. The sauce that covered the roll with was so garlicky with hot spice that it wasn't a compliment to the rolls flavors at all. So I pushed the top of it aside to get to the spicy tuna and it tasted weird. I wonder if it was even tuna at all! 

The other roll was a mango salmon roll w cream cheese. Once again the salmon wasn't fresh and the crab that filled the roll was smothered in a extremely sweet sauce. I couldn't eat it. $28 thrown away,  soooo frustrating. I will never go back there.
My favorite sushi place!! The staff so awesome!! Always have a good time, spectacular food!!! Can't stay away ha-ha.

Sushi-AMAZING!  I have been coming here for almost 2 years (moved here a little over 2 years ago).  I have been to many Sushi joints including the 5 star posh restaurants all the way to the dingy.  This is by far the best in the Phoenix area.  The seafood is always very fresh, and they have market fresh specials all the time.  I always get something off the hand written board, which are the chef's specials or the items that are market fresh.  You should definitely sit at the sushi bar if seats are available.  The service at the tables is not the best, they don't have a very broad alcoholic beverage selection, the decor also not fabulous, the dingy strip mall surrounding it and all the pawn shops-awful....but, we came for sushi and WOW.

I had not been to Kampai in a while when I went for a birthday dinner on November 30th. Imagine my surprise to discover it was under new management (I should have read the recent reviews first). I was a fan of Kampai because it was possibly the most authentic Japanese restaurant in Phoenix.

The decor hasn't changed (which, frankly, could use some refreshing, like the seat cushions in the booths are sagging, but overall, is still quite serviceable and even charming), but the menu has changed radically and now includes an almost encyclopedic collection of "maki" sushi (sushi rolls), most of which seem be to calculated to appeal to western tastes. Think Philly and California rolls (along with Caterpillar rolls, Arizona rolls, etc.). Yes, you can still get sushi by the piece, but not sure if I'd bother, they didn't even have tamago (egg omelet) and the surf clam (both nigiri) we had fell apart. Perhaps they should stick with chirashizushi instead of nigiri. I also didn't think the sushi rice was well prepared or that the fish was properly chilled (it seemed a tad warm). I was not impressed.

Along with the sushi we also had a cucumber and seaweed salad (actually, sunomono) which was surprisingly good.

Compliments, however, to the wait staff as they were exceedingly attentive and food and drinks were served with a smile and promptly. The staff is probably what stopped me from leaving too quickly (the staff under previous management was always warm and welcoming and I miss them).

Now for the food coming out of the kitchen: Another delightful surprise, it was well executed. It was obvious to me that the tempura recipe was slightly different than previously, but it was well done and not greasy. A few details were off-putting, though, there was no gobo root in the vegetable mix and far too many slices of potato, and this time, pieces of chicken, too, which were a little stringy, I'd rather have had an additional shrimp (the large prawns were cut in half lengthwise and served in individually making the serving seem more generous than it was).

Also since the new management, the prices have risen rather steeply: Una-ju (eel over rice) is up sharply and several other items went up as well. Given recent economic times and the rise in restaurant prices, I'm not sure this is entirely fair, but some of the prices went up rather surprisingly high. It is easy, with drinks, to run to over $30.00 per person.

The new restaurant menu is all over the place: It appears that the new owners have tried to keep the core menu, but other additions make it seem disorganized, as if they are trying to please too many. The new menu has Fried rice, bulgogki, tempura, nabeyaki. Fried rice? And, yes, something like an encyclopedia of sushi rolls (2 pages worth).

I went to Kampai because it reminded me of restaurants when I was in Japan. It was not striving for fusion or pan-Asain cuisine, or tons of novelty - a new dish now and then, fine, but was a solid example of quietly typical Japanese cuisine; quality classic food and an intimate atmosphere rather than catering to western ideas of what sushi and Japanese food "should" be or giving into food fads. I was always gratified to see members of the local ex-pat Japanese community eating there. And now I don't know where to sate my addiction to Japanese cuisine. Any recommendations greatly appreciated, as I don't know if I will be back to the new Kampai.

I would like to first start off with their poor customer service that I received on 03/20/18. I was apart of a party of 3 and the host or owner (not sure) told us to follow him which we did; unfortunately, the table that he planned to seat us at wasn't available we continued to follow him to the opposite side of the restaurant where he didn't know where to seat us. The phone suddenly rung and he decided that a potential consumer on the phone was better than actual consumers in front of him? As we stood there in disbelief a young woman helped us finally to our seat (she would later be our waitress). Next is the food, my party did the buffet while I ordered spicy tuna rolls and Pad Thai, overall we loved all the rolls that we ordered as well as the orange chicken; however, the Mongolian beef was all onions with little beef and my Pad Thai was so abysmal the smell alone would disgust you! I decided to give it a try anyway and with one small bite I knew I couldn't continue it had a vinegar smell and taste and anyone who's had Pad Thai know that shouldn't be the case. I informed the waitress and she graciously removed it from our bill. In conclusion Two stars only because of the rolls and orange chicken; I won't be returning.
We love coming to Sushi Avenue! The prices are great especially during happy hour. We have been coming here for over Eight years. Service is great and food is even better!

I like this place. It's close to home, has a great atmosphere, and good sushi.

If the sushi was better, we would be in heaven and would eat there way too much. 

However, the sushi is good. Not great. We could eat there an be satisfied, but never really go "wow, this is good."

Know what I mean?
One of our favorite local sushi places. Good quality and selection, and not very expensive. We usually get sushi for takeout, and they've never had an order wrong (knock on wood).

For sushi in the north valley, I'd take the drive to Sakana (NWC 59th Ave & 101) over this place.

I've been to this restaurant three times in as many years, and all three times there has been an odd chemical/fish smell when you walk in the door.  I didn't like it the first time, but I'm a believer that you should give a restaurant a couple of chances.  I did, and now I won't go back.

When I ordered their Las Vegas roll, it had scallions inside the roll; I'm not sure if this is usually what is in a Las Vegas roll, but I didn't like it.

Great sushi, nice environment, good appetizers. I will be back very soon! There are plenty of options on the menu. I tried their most spicey roll and it definitely has a kick, and I'm a spicey fan. The presentation is very nice as well.

We decided to give this place a shot because they have a good looking happy hour, and it's very close to our home. My sister said their veggie roll was good. It was, but everything else was a disappointment.

There was only one other table occupied and a couple at the bar, yet our server was slow and forgot to bring out several items. Our sushi, something that relies on great presentation, was served on chipped white china. We're talking huge chips here. I can't believe they didn't throw the pieces out.

The food was all pretty bad. I got the egg nigiri, and it was the worst I've ever had. How do you screw up what is essentially an omelette on rice? My husband liked his pink lady roll (not on happy hour), but the 4 other rolls and nigiri he downed only out of ravenous hunger.

If you live in this area, stick with Sakana for well-priced decent sushi.

Best Sushi in Gilbert, AZ! 

With sushi you never know if it is going to be fresh or not, but Sushi Ave always has the freshest ingredients. Also, the FREE dessert they give you at the end of your meal is delicious and unique.

Their regular and happy hour (Mon-Fri, 4p-7p) prices are perfect.

Been here a few times. Food is great, but if you go during dinner hours expect to wait a while to even be greeted and then seated.  Then wait another LONG while for the sushi ( much longer than other sushi places) . They get very busy and are understaffed. We will go again but not during dinner time.

20 years for me and sad to see them go.  Sadder still to see a great traditional Japanese sushi restaurant end, and not carry on the tradition.  We would go here for consistently great fresh fish and great service.  They have also trained many young sushi chefs through the years here in Phoenix.  Great Japanese food isn't about fancy rolls and combinations, but about great fresh ingredients.  END OF AN ERA.  I agree.

Very good modern sushi place with great happy hour specials. The place was very busy on a Friday night, but we got seated within 8 minutes. The service was very fast and the quality of food was reasonable .  Good presentation as well.
I was disappointed that the didn't have the red bean ice cream that was on the menu.

This place would be a 5 star if the service was a bit better and the sushi roll size a bit bigger. The food and atmosphere were spot on. Truly enjoyed the taste of it, just disappointed on how small my California rolls were. I will definitely try this place again and update my review based off of my next visit. 

Lastly, they have a great happy hour and also serve liquor.

Definitely coming back to Sushi Ave! Perfect place to get delicious sushi rolls and teriyaki chicken on a Saturday night! Our Las Vegas roll was super tasty and I loved their teriyaki chicken. The entree came with miso soup and the salad I love and you can definitely share since it's a big entree. We also got a free little dessert! 

Can't wait to come back for their lunch specials!

This was my first time eating here and I had the Las Vegas Roll. I don't care for seafood that much, however, this was phenomenal. I ordered only one and ended up ordering another roll after my first bite. My boyfriend ordered the chicken yakisoba and loved it. Can't say it enough, this place is delicious.

An incredibly cute restaurant with delicious sushi! If you're a regular, you can have your own personal set of chopsticks that are displayed at the front. Will be coming here for a long time to come! Yay!

My sister and I come here all the time and every time we're here the service is just as amazing as the food. This is our favorite place to come to for sushi because the food comes out very quick and is always incredible. If you're looking  for a good and local sushi place definitely check this place out!

Sushi was great, but the service lacked a little. We've only had dinner here one time so, the jury is still out on this place. I hear great things about theier happy hour so, we'll have to give that a shot the next time.

Stopped by this place for lunch - because I remembered this place was decent last time I went there a few years ago... I was so disappointed with the quality of the food. I read some reviews after I came home and now I know why - under the new management. All my sashimi tasted so old and the sushi rice was way too much vinegar in it. The server was nice but the food was bad. I will not go back there ever again. Too sad because it used to be a good restaurant.
Hi. We love coming here everything they have is fantastic.  We enjoy eating here very much.  And swing by quite often. Thx again will be back soon.  Danny and family.
I enjoyed my sushi rolls.  Staff was friendly and the place is clean and nice inside.

So, I have to be honest and say that I wasn't exactly stoked to eat at this place.  It shares a building with an automotive supply store and I thought for sure that I'd be losing my dinner faster than I ate it.  My husband suggested it because our usual spot had closed down and I was craving sushi.  "Let's go to Sushi Ave" was a phrase I was positive that I would regret...

SURPRISE!  This place is great.  The first time we went we had amazing service and the food was good.  The second time we went, the service was amazing and the food was delicious.  I think that my only gripe would be that the rolls are huge and I had to google the appropriate way to eat large pieces; it's all or nothing, btw.  My favorite treat was at the end of the meal when they brought 1/2 an orange drizzled with chocolate and whipped cream.  Ugh, I'm hungry again...

Sushi Ave is our new fav sushi place and I am so happy about that.

Best sushi in town!  Love the Arizona roll! Brent our server was quick to serve and take care of our sushi needs! Haven't gotten a bad sushi roll and we've tried just about every one on the menu! Thanks Sushi Ave!
Awesome happy hour with awesome sushi. The place is small, but has some of the best sushi on this side of Gilbert.

Second time coming here and I can not get enough!  Reverse happy hour $5 Sake bombers and rolls. I'm not sure which rolls are on reverse happy hour but today we tried the bbq short rib, jalape√±o roll, and the fever roll which is flambe'd. As usual the presentation was fantastic and tasted phenomenal. My favorite menu item is fresh Wasabi!  Yes you read that right they have fresh Wasabi available for only $3, if you've never had it get it. Once you have fresh you'll notice the huge difference between it and the powder one. For dessert the tempura cheesecake,  again it was phenomenal. I have yet to be disappointed, we enjoy coming here so much that we asked to be on the patron chopstick wall.  You get your own chopsticks every time you come in and don't have to use the large chopsticks, at least in my opinion.
This is my favorite sushi restaurant in the East valley. They have good customer service and are always pretty quick on getting the food out.

Great neighborhood sushi bar. They even have shelves near the entrance with your own personal chopsticks labeled. We came for lunch and we're the only patrons for the first 45 minutes. Everything we got had great flavor. Las Vegas and shrimp tempura rolls, mixed tempura bento box, edamame and miso. All very good.

So hubby and I were having a date night and we just stopped in here on a whim.  What luck! The sushi was very fresh and they had so many on the menu that it was hard to choose! The service was great.  They were all really attentive and very nice!  I can't wait to go back and try all the other sushi that we missed out on.

I came here today with a friend after driving by and seeing the sign for happy hour from 4p-7p on weekdays. The selection was pretty decent, and for 2 people, we ordered about 6 rolls. They were a good size for happy hour, and included a few special rolls. Our favorite was the New York roll and the calamari tempura roll, which we new to us. They're not stingy with spicy mayo or ginger, which is actually really important to me. The ambience inside is nice, and the spot is clean as well. They seem to have a lot of repeat customers because you can save your chopsticks on a shelf for next time. It's very close to home, so I'd definitely stop by again for happy hour. They also give you a little orange as dessert, which is cute!

Awesome fresh sushi and great service! Highly recommend!! My favorites are the Las Vegas and Philly but they have a long list of unique rolls. Good location and you can even save your decorative chopsticks for the future.

What even is the real name of this restaurant? Is it Kanpai as written on the door? Is it Kampai as written on the sign? I actually have no idea and for the sake of this review, it doesn't really matter. Here is what is important about this little restaurant on the west side of town. The two chefs who own and run this restaurant, brought sushi to the valley. No, I am not kidding and its not debatable, AJ and Yuki are the original gangsters of the sushi manifestation that has occurred in Phoenix. 

In order to understand this revelation, we need to go back to 1985(see what I did there). A small sushi restaurant opens in Paradise Valley, right across the street from the mall. It is called Shogun and for many years is the premier sushi restaurant in the valley. Actually, for a while, it was the only sushi restaurant in the valley. Shogun has gone through various restorations and renovations over the years, but originally, it was AJ and Yuki at the small sushi bar inside Shogun with around five or six tables. These sushi geniuses built Shogun into the dynasty that it was and after a few years, moved onto their own venture, named Kampai or Kanpai, depending on which signage you are currently viewing. 

Kampai, found in a very shady strip mall on Bell road, has the best sushi in the valley. There is not a close second. Yuki is the main sushi chef and AJ runs the back end kitchen. Word of warning and the reason for the lack of five stars in this review. If Yuki is not your sushi chef, I cannot vouch for the restaurant at all. I know I know, that sounds brutal, but it's the truth. Yuki is an artist and meticulous. The other chefs just are not in his league and some of the specialties of the house, only taste their best when made from Yuki's hands. 

What makes this place so special? It certainly isn't the decor, which could not be more plain. It is far from the waitress service that is at best, hard to understand. It is the fact that the spicy tuna hand roll is the best I have ever had. The southwest salmon roll, while not only amazing, is only found at this sushi bar, no matter where in the country I have dined on sushi. The southwest salmon roll Is an inside out roll, with salmon and a house cured chili pepper with cucumber and masago on the outside. It is my favorite sushi roll on the planet. As for the sushi, this is the only place in the valley, besides Hiro in North Scottsdale, who serves live scallops. At Hiro, you will pay an arm and a leg, at Kampai, they will be fresher and you will pay fair market price, as set by AJ. The yellowtail and salmon sushi are always cured perfectly, not salty and melt in your mouth. 

There are both entree specials and sushi specials listed on the white boards above and next to the sushi bar. AJ makes the best salmon and yellowtail collars in the business, while serving better versions of the standard sushi bar appetizer fare, IE. Fried oysters, tempura, etc.. 

I will end this review here, but rest assured, if you are looking for the best, most authentic sushi dinner in the valley, Kampai is the place.

This is my favorite spot for sushi in the valley. I think I've tried almost every roll here and have not been disappointed. The menu includes pictures, which I always love when picking out some fun options. They set the Volcano roll on fire and it just melts in your mouth. The Las Vegas and New York rolls are also good. The Hawaiian roll in good, the Spider (Crab) roll, I could go on and on. There are so many great choices. The staff here is also super friendly. 

I'm getting hungry just thinking about this place. Just got to get the boyfriend to like sushi. I made him try the really good stuff in NYC and he hasn't been the same ever since.   :p
Best sushi around. You won't find fresher fish anywhere. Special shout out for the white tuna!

Came here for happy hour and very pleased with the price, quality and service. I was in a hurry and the staff was very diligent and got us our food fast. The quality is great. Our favorite from happy hour so far is the New York roll. Tip: they offer 10$ gift certificate for showing yelp review!

Rude, rude, rude.

I would give them less than one star, but yelp won't let me click that.

Last night was my third visit to KAMPAI and each time I went, the love that I felt the first time, has now rubbed me the wrong way. I'm a chow hound and always seek the best, and I had found it here... the sushi the way I like it... 

I've bounced around to several sushi bars throughout the city (I'm a once or twice a week -aholic). It's my ol' standby dinner and I was please to have found this place only two blocks from where I live! But for last night I stopped in for some Nigiri Sushi togo and was told 'we are closed'. As I look around the room (which was filled with people) I ask again and was rudely and coldly told 'we are closed'. Ok I'll give them that they do close at 9:00 pm and there was fifteen minutes before that happens and they still have patrons still having their dinners, and a to go order should not be such a imposition on them. With this economy, nobody should be turning away customers, thirty bucks is thirty bucks they should be glad to have customers like me who do return and spend their hard earned money with them. Return loyal customers are what business strive for, or so I thought.

I realize it was a full moon last night, it was beautiful, I know. I actually took time to make a mental note of how lovely it was as my rumbling stomach screamed 'feed me'.
The sushi is really good! You don't wait long to get your food which is great. I would come here again!

For me, there are two types of sushi restaurants in cities outside of New York and LA, where Japanese restaurants are abundant and go beyond traditional sushi fare.

Type 1 - "All About The Decor" - These sushi restaurants are more concerned with the overall aesthetic, where the budget and level of importance is clearly put toward fancy tables, expensive light fixtures, majestic waterfalls, flaming centerpieces, state-of-the-art sound systems and a wait staff waiting to be discovered. Let's not be confused here - the food is really an afterthought. 

Type 2 - "All About The Food" - These type of sushi restaurants exist off the main drags, resting subtly in dimly lit corners of strip malls next to dollar stores, or in the case of Kampai, a bowling alley. They are typically "mom and pop" family run organizations, poorly decorated, and have a singular focus - really fresh and really good food. 

Kampai is your classic Type 2 joint. I've been many times now, only getting around to writing this review after another visit. It's simple, straight forward sushi. Always fresh, with the standard menu expected by those who want straight forward sushi in a no frills environment. 

There's no music blaring and no crazy list of rolls with ridiculously named concoctions with so many ingredients, you really can't identify any flavors once it hits your tongue. 

Don't get me wrong, there's always a time and place for Type 1 sushi places - parties, happy hours, etc. But if you want good food, fresh fish, a straight forward selection and all of it prepared by actual sushi chefs speaking Japanese, look not further.      

Author's Note: If you watch shows like No Reservations, you'll know that Anthony Bourdain always speaks highly of places like Kampai and would never find himself in Type 1 restaurants.

Not good. Ordered a spicy tuna roll; mostly rice, and cucumber. Quality was not good, sashimi was plain and presentation was terrible. I pulled up at noon, not one car in the lot, I was the only customer....
Love this place! Great sushi and specials! Fist place I got sushi flamb√© and it was awesome. Who knew!

Considering it is in the same complex as a bowling alley I wasn't expecting much when I walked into this place.  Thankfully I was pleasantly pleased with the food. The albacore and salmon nigiri were quite good.  The staff was very nice so I'm a little confused by some of the reviews   My only complaint was the hamachi sashimi was a bit on the small side but the quality was excellent.  All in all I'll be back, especially since it's close to the house.

We ordered the tropical roll and it was so unbelievably good. The sauce was sweet with a mild spice to it and it was just really fantastic. 
The environment is really chill and good vibes all around. 
Definitely check out this place. You won't regret it.

Before this place was taken over by Sushi Ave it was Kumpia's. Kumpai's was awesome!! I had been going there for years. Now that it's Sushi Ave it kinda sucks. The waitress kept ignoring us and when I asked her how the Tataki was made she just said I don't know. Didn't ask a sushi chef nothing, just I don't know. This place definitely isn't my top pick. The food is pretty good but the service sucks.

We went here for Happy Hour. The cucumber salad, edamame, and red bean mochi were great. I liked the miso. Everything else that we got was good. They have a wall for regular guests to keep their chopsticks, which is a great idea that seems uniquely personal. I have not decided yet, but we might become regular enough to get our chopsticks there as well. We spent more than we were planning, but I am not sure if that is because of the price or because we loved it.

i went here and didn't have high expectations  because it was new to me. OMG  everything was so good. i got a bento box and two rolls. happy hour  for lunch was perfect. service was great. i will be back.
Love the new lunch menu. I will have to come back after work to try out the infused saki.
Overall pretty good. Cant be kinda slow when busy. Great happy hour though dine in only.

I've been wanting to try this sushi joint out for a while due to the reviews on yelp. We have 2 small children so I ordered pickup on a Friday around happy hour. Upon arrival to pick up our food, I noticed a lot of dust on the decor including a pretty disturbing spider web on a few lights.
