Other than that, the staff was nice and the sushi was good and seemed pretty fresh.  I am torn on whether or not I will return since it was pretty pricey for 4 rolls, and an appetizer.
I've lived in the east valley for 4.5 years,  and I've finally found my sushi spot! Great customer service & the rolls are outstanding! Yum! We'll definitely be back!

Unfortunately, I have to change my rating for this restaurant - the original owner has sold this place. We were excited to see new owners left the same menu, but the execution was a huge disappointment. We actually didn't finish half of the rolls we ordered, though we were still hungry. It is quite upsetting...  I don't know if new owners need more time to master this menu, but I don't see any hope.  If you go, please order one or 2 dishes you used to eat there and see if you still like them, don't waste your money as we did.

This place is close to home, so I was really hoping that it would be better. I had good service, prompt seating, good attitude from waiter. What surprised me was the quality, or lack of quality of the food. I ordered two items, and on one of the rolls, you could see that one of the pieces of fish was just sitting on top. So it was difficult to eat as it kept falling apart. The fish did not seem fresh to me. So even though it was inexpensive, I did not think that there was good value.

I recently moved to AZ from Cali a few months ago and when I got hungry for Asian food (Udon specifically) I Googled udon and a location called Kanpai came up..well after reading further it seemed like the wrong website for the location but I decided to give it a shot anyway...Boy am I glad Google made that mistake...I have now gone to at least 1/2 a doz diff locations in the phx/Scottsdale area not to mention all the ones Ive gone to in Cali and this place by FAR takes the cake. The sushi is some of the freshest Ive had and the texture is perfect..the Albacore melts in your mouth as does the cured salmon (which isnt on the menu btw)

The 2nd time I went in I brought my roommate and we sat at the bar, We introduced ourselves to the chef whose name is E.J. we talked back and forth etc etc..well a few weeks later I went in and E.J. Instantly remembered my name and proceeded to ask how my roommate was by name. The next time I went in I talked for about 20min with one of the owners...You can tell they take a lot of pride in the quality of the food and customer service.

Kampai has been there for 18 years was one of only 6 other sushi houses, now there are over 200 different restaurants in Scottsdale/phoenix alone. Dont be fooled by the fact that its located in the back of a small center  next to a bowling alley..its a hidden gem in the rough!

Stopped in on a late Saturday night, 25 min before closing to satisfy a sushi craving. Ordered a few appetizers, a few rolls and sashimi.  At best the food was average, rolls were loose and fell apart when "dipping" in the soy.  Service was good and attentive.  Was really surprised to find the tuna kinda chewy.  Pricing ....  Three rolls, 3 appetizers, three pieces of sashimi and a beer was over 70.00 without tip.  Nice touch with the pineapple and whipped cream desert (free).  So, in short, ok place for a sushi craving but just average for price and quality.

Not bad at all. Sushi was fresh and large portions. Server was very pleasant. Food seemed to take a long time to come out but it is happy hour and only one chef behind the sushi bar. Would recommend to others! Came with a super cute dessert at the end!

If you are looking for freshly rolled Sushi and can't make it out of the East Valley, this place might work.  Small dive kind of place next to a Auto Parts Store and Veterinarian Office.

The rolls were a step above store bought and the atmosphere was dark and cold.  Not the social meeting place found at the Sushi Bars I am use to in Ventura CA.

I've visited twice.  The most recent night my fiance and I visited there was a table of about 8 regulars right in the middle of the confined bar who were loud and obnoxious and ruined our dining experience.

Not impressed.

We've tried many of the sushi spots in and around Gilbert and keep coming back to Sushi Ave for their delicious dishes and reasonable prices. We always get the Tootsie Roll. You really can't go wrong here.
Food has always been delish 7roles 7in my tummy yum yum yum. Great happy hour great price

We have been coming to sushi ave for years and it is our favorite go to sushi restaurant. The staff is very nice and the food is to die for! Try the Las Vegas rolls, they are the best! Great prices! Highly recommend!

I loved this place! The menu had pictures, which helped us pick out some tasty rolls! The New York roll was our fav!
Friendly staff and a neat ambiance!
We'll be back!

A family favorite!

I always order the chicken katsu I've ever had, though Ra Sushi makes a pretty decent one too. The chicken is incredibly tender and lightly battered with panko bread crumbs, but it is not at all greasy. I wonder if they bake it?

I usually come here with my parents who both order the tempura soba. I always mooch a little because it is so good. The brother is delicious, but I always add some pepper flakes to spice it up. There are tempura batter morsels floating around too, adding a little crunch and dimension to the dish. 

I've ordered the sushi a couple times, but I have to admit I'm not a fan since the portions are indeed skimpy.

No lie, service is inconsistent. Crowd or no crowd, they will be lightening fast one day and super snail-pace slow the next. Seating usually isn't a problem, but I normally go during the week. True, the servers don't speak English very well, but they are super nice and accommodating.
Great little hidden spot. Rolls are all delicious, had the Maui, Crazy Lobster and sweet potato roll. Looking forward to my next visit!

Wow, just got take out for the first time last night. Seaweed Salad, California Roll and Spicy Salmon Roll. The salad was fresh and delicious with a slight hint of heat. Very, very good. The rolls were both delicious as well. Very fresh and the rice was light and fluffy. The kind of sushi I like to close my eyes and enjoy while eating it. When I went to pick it up, I was surprised at how nice the restaurant was inside. It's just a tiny storefront next to an auto parts store. My wife and I will be going in soon to try more food.

I went to dinner at Kampai with a friend.  There was a decent crowd as usual.  I have been there a couple of times before a few years back and it was crowded back then.  I think it's because Kampai has the sushi market in that neighborhood.  That area of Bell Road is pretty bleak when it comes to restaurants.  

The service was short and impersonal.  The vegetable tempura we started with, was a tiny portion.  The yellowtail sashimi seemed like a half order cut into smaller pieces to fool me, the customer, that I was getting more pieces of fish.  Skimpy skimpy skimpy!!!

On a positive note the mackerel nigiri was good.

Meh, I"ve experienced better.

Always impressed when we pick Sushi Ave for dinner. Service is amazing and always on point. Sushi is the best we have had in the years we have been coming. My fianc√© loves the Miso soup and I love trying new rolls. Thank you for being our little sushi restaurant down the road.
Normally don't like sushi because it tastes to fishy. Best sushi I've ever had, plenty of raw fish and I never would have known except they told me it's raw fish. Amazingly delicious

Had some happy hour rolls. It was good! California rolls surprised me. I usually don't order them, but the gf was willing to share and I thought they were good.

Can't say much for the rest of the menu, but the service was good.
Phily roll is on some next level stuff. Nice dining area and great location near the freeway (60). Definitely coming back

Had a great experience. The sushi was different, the rice is a black/purple color which had no different taste to it. The sushi tasted fresh!! The vibe was good and the service was decent. Definitely eating here more often!

It was my first time there. Not impresses. I ordered shrimp tempura roll. (Where was the tempura). Also when the waitress sat us down she left a red sharpie and a page, with not instruction or suggestions on what to order? The roll was rather large (that was a plus) but pretty bland. My hubbie ordered shrimp fried rice. It was not a standout. The shrimp looked and tasted like something you buy at the grocery store, or out of a can. My husbands drink was tasteless...how can you mess Sprite up? Anyhow, probably will not go back. There was a lot of weird stuff on the counters, (rancid or fermenting sake? i assume) it just looked gross...

Sushi Ave is just around the corner from my house and is my "go to" when I'm having a sudden craving for sushi. I always have a good experience here. The food is good- the service is fast and friendly and it is very affordable. Makes for a great meal in my book!

I like this place. It's never overly crowded, the food is always decent. The price is about average. The employees are always great, and have a good sense of humor. Cant think of anything negative to say. So...I guess I'm a fan.

I walk in take a seat at the sushi bar as I was writing what i wanted on my sushi card card. A couple walked in sat down next to me. The bar tender associate immediately rushed them octopus sashimi. As I continued to wait, I renewed my registration on-line. While this was happening I noticed him making a shrimp tempura roll which just by chance Is what I ordered 15 mins prior. NOPE I WAS WRONG!!! It went to the couple that had just sat down next to me. Sushi was fair not great and I paid $25 for 2 rolls not bad... but for the quality of service NOT GOOD. If I ever go back I will just make sure I go with regulars too get good service.
Service was awesome sushi was awesome!! I would highly recommend this Sushi Ave. I could have had 4 of the Arizona rolls! We will definitely be back!
This is a good local and friendly sushi place with decent lunch and happy hour specials.

This was my go-to sushi place when I was still in Gilbert, decided to come back last week with my husband as I missed the place. The place is still awesome as always, the service was great & the food definitely the bomb! I would say this is my favorite sushi place here in the Valley, not to mention the price is also pocket friendly. The Sushis were all made meticulously by the chef! I never skipped baked mussels whenever I visit here, and my hubby's favorite is the lobster roll. You can try all their sushis and you can never go wrong.

Horrible service. As many other reviewers have stated, if you are not a regular expect to wait close to an hour while others around that arrived, after you, are served. Completely rude and unapologetic staff. Charged us for a roll that was never even served, after waiting over an hour.
After coming here frequently a couple years prior, any fond memory is destroyed with my most recent visit in addition to multiple other reviewers.

This is quite the change from the previous sushi place that was there.  It's very clean and the service was excellent!  We ordered the maui roll which had delicious mango sauce, the ultimate Philly roll with fresh salmon, and the baked scallop roll came out hot with a tremendous amount of scallops!  All the rolls were fresh and a great size.  There was just 2 of us and we were very filled at the end.  They had happy hour prices on this particular Saturday night.  The place was quiet which was the only thing that made us feel uneasy walking in as there was only one couple at 7:30 on a Saturday however there was nothing to worry about as the food and service was wonderful.  The bathrooms were clean and the floors were also well maintained.  We spent $53 including tip for 3 specialty rolls, wine and kirin.  We would definitely come back.

I was happy the last time I went here, I love the lunch specials with the roll on roll combo that do included the Vegas rolls for under 9 bucks. It's just enough to fill u up. I have been here 4 times and always leave happy, give it a try.

Ownership changed, serve Korean package spicy boodle as Japanese ramen, how dare they.
we have been here over 15 years, not going back any more.

Came in to try happy hour which I saw from driving by with a few prices posted on the A frame. I placed my order then later I was informed the  posted prices would not honored. What a scam. Post lower prices then secretly charge a higher price. Wow!!!  How people say this is the best clearly don't know what quality and fresh mean. The wasabi was powdery and gritty and the ginger is in a small container passed from table to table. We ordered the  New York,  Shrimp Roll, Dynamite Roll and Pot Stickers. The Dynamite was kool when it was set on fire but was very greasy and seamed drenched in mayonnaise.   The pot stickers were store bought,  burnt, and very dry. Huge disappointment.  The New York and Shrimp Roll were ok but lacked flavor and freshness. The exterior of the place is full of faded window paint with a daycare like appearance. We waited quite a bit for our food so to receive such poor quality food was surprising.

I found this place when I lived in the area 4 years ago.  By far the best in the Valley that I have come across.  I have tried other places and keep saying to my better half, not as good as Shawn's!  They recently remodeled the place for those that think shiny and new makes the food better, it doesn't but hey that's your hang up, less waiting in line for me..  The staff like Shawn make the place inviting and make you feel like they care and it feels like an extension of your home.  Living in Mesa I still make the drive just because this is by far the best Sushi in the Valley.
Unfortunately it was recently sold and is no longer the wonderful gem it once was. Very sad.  Don't waste your time or money here.

So I've been eating at sushi ave for a long time and have always loved the food. I became kind of a regular customer and we came during happy hour a lot. This last time we went in the waitress was very very rude. Not even half way through our meal she slammed the check on our table and stormed away. She then came back every 5-10 minutes picked up the check and looked to see if we had paid yet. It was super distracting and felt really hostile. The friend I was with went to the restroom and she swooped in and snatched out half eaten food ignoring me when I told her we were still working on it. Then she harassed me several more times while my friend was in the restroom about the check. As soon as he was back we paid and left. I probably won't be back.

I just moved from New York, i was on the way home from my sons appointment we came across this small sushi place! I was a little nervous as i didn't research this place before, I'm glad i chose to came in!! service was great as well as the food i will be coming back

I'll be honest here.   The sushi is really good! Even the non-sushi items are really good.  But the service is really bad!   I'm not saying the servers are rude just slow and very slow.   I've checked out Kampai for over a year , sometimes 2 times a week for lunch service.   The place is usually half full and it still takes the chefs forever to get our orders out!  The last time we went it took 55 mins!!! Hello! It's lunch time, people usually have an hour or less for lunch and need to get back to work!   We stated that we'd need separate checks and were told that was fine but that they would charge 15% tip to each bill.  That's fine but when half of us had to tk our lunch to go versus enjoying it during lunch hour!!!!  WTF!!!!!!    We rushed and paid our bills w/ our 15% tip.   
Needless to say we are going to find another sushi restaurant that knows how to get the lunch crowd served and out on time!!!! 

I only gv Kampai 2 stars bc the food is good.
Delicious food, beautiful presentation and charming environment in an unlikely lication! Oh, did I mention on the cheap for happy hour?! (M-f 3-6 & 8-9:30) $5 rolls and $2 miso soup. Yes, please!

I'm not one who usually writes reviews, but this place definitely deserves it!

Sushi Ave was formerly called Kanpai Sushi. It was my favorite sushi restaurant of all time. When they were bought out by Sushi Ave I was not thrilled, but I forced myself to give them a try. 

I've been there twice in the last week! It's my new favorite! 

Rolls and other foods are placed creatively on white china with an artsy flare to the drizzle of sauces. 

Both times I've been there, there were these two very sweet and well-mannered women: one the head chef, and one the hostess/waitress.

Sushi Ave doesn't generate as much traffic as Kanpai did (at least from what I've seen), but with it's food surpassing the taste/quality of the previous business there, it definitely deserves it in my opinion!

The head chef this time gave me two fried delicious crab puffs on sticks on the house! Yum Yum!! Then satisfied my tastebuds further with another "On-the-House" treat of sliced fried pineapple with chocolate sauce & whipped cream!

Back again today! I came here for the first time last week and wasn't too sure at first glance since it's next to an auto parts store lol. Don't let that fool you! This is honestly the best sushi I've ever had!

I ordered a variety of sushi. The ultimate rainbow roll was so so yummy. I also had salmon sashimi that I loved..... So so good. I was anxious because I'm from Cali and was thinking it wouldn't be as fresh but I couldn't tell the difference.

Decided to try a new sushi spot by my work and glad I did. Fresh squid salad, fresh sashimi and tried the ultimate rainbow roll and it was bomb!  Definitely recommend it and they have happy hour from 11:30 to 2.

Aweful all around. Waited 20 minutes to get seated and then waited another forty for our food - which we received four sushi pieces and the waitress told us they were out of the other sushi we ordered. Yet the table behind us was getting plenty of sushi delivered to them. The price was was to expensive for what we received and the staff didn't even apoligize for not coming over sooner to let us know they were out of what we ordered. 

Good thing the company I went with was great to pass the time

This place is so good I often come here just too get away from my Girl Friend who I hate so much . 

One day me and her had a huge argument and she said if you don't get me an engagement ring WE ARE DONE ! 

20 min I Instagram her a picture of my self at sushi ave . enjoying some creamy Cali rolls :)

This is our go-to place for sushi!  They will keep a set of chopsticks of your choice in a personalized carafe on the wall, so you can use each time you visit! The service is always fast and friendly.  The miso and green tea are hot, fresh, and tasty.  The edamame is perfectly steamed and seasoned, and the sushi is some of the best we've ever.  The rolls are larger in diameter than most, and the selection is huge.  The Crazy Lobster roll is our fave.  Kampai!

Sushi Ave is great!! Super easy going and fast service. The sushi is one of the best in gilbert! Our favorite roll was the rolling tiger-highly recommend. The little orange dessert at the end is always a plus too:)

Service wasn't good, wasn't bad.  

The chefs are really nice and helpful.  

Not the best sushi in town and their portions are really small for the price.

Tried this place for the first time about 2 weeks ago, was back 2 more times in 7 days.  Try the Jalapeno popper appetizer  soooo Good!!  So far every roll I have had is great.  Staff is awesome.  Friday nights are a bit busy but they still take care of you and if you have to wait its worth it.   Staff is very nice and friendly.  I am sure most people look what its attached to a Auto parts store what??  LOL Go its so worth it!  enjoy

We love this place! Started coming here shortly after we moved in the neighborhood and haven't gone to any other sushi place in the local area. Sushi and nigiri are delicious! My favorite part, aside from the sake bombs, are the potstickers! Oh and happy hour prices are great!
This place is awesome! Great happy hour prices and even better sushi. Service is great as well. Highly recommend it!
Happy hour is fun!  I really like the chef there.  He is very sweet and welcoming.

Honestly when I walked in it seemed dark and I was like oooooh nooooo. Looked at the menu, great prices and looked safe then I got my plate and oh my gosh. GREAT sushi!! Authentic sashimi with the wasabi between fish and rice, fresh, and delicious fish. Definitely a must try when you're in the area.
First timer! Very fun and clean atmosphere! Friendly staff! GREAT SPECIALS AND SUSHI! Very unique personal chopsticks idea!

This is one of those gems in the rough located in Mesa in the same plaza auto zone it has the best miso soup in town. Skip all the hype (ra) if you re in Mesa and come and enjoy king crab roll for eight bucks during happy hour between 3 and 6

I've been here several times over a period of 7 years, it use to be my go to Valentine's Day dinner date night, but the few times I've been the service seems just ok.

I went there today and the sushi is great, it's one of my favorite places to eat sushi in Phoenix, although my favorite is Sushi Cho in Tucson.  Anyways, today it took a couple minutes to get a menu and I actually had to ask the Sushi chef for one and it took about 10 minutes for the waitress to even ask what I wanted to drink.

It took another 10 minutes to get my plum wine and water.  One of my orders came out probably about 5 - 10 minutes after I got my drink, but I had two more kinds of sushi coming.  By the time my last order came out it was a cumulative total of about 35 minutes.

I didn't dare ask for another plum wine in fear of being there for another 20 minutes.

I'm kind of disappointed that they either have staffing problems or just like taking their time, because their food is quite good.  Although, over the last few years I have noticed changes in portions.

I ordered my usual albacore tataki and it's just not the same.

First time trying sushi!

I got the California and the crunch California. I tried the Ohilly and the New York and they were amazing.

Service and atmosphere was nice!
This place is fantastic. Very reasonable happy hour prices till 7pm.  I loved the crab jalapeno poppers and the energizer roll was delicious.  We will definitely be back.

This location is awful. They changed names and nothing actually changed besides that. Food isn't very good. Dinners come with nothing but mounds of onions. So many better places to choose from. Won't be going back.
I LOVE sushi ave, great food, great prices and friendly staff. I will definitely be returning.

I have been to many sushi places in the valley, and this is by far my favorite. The sushi was amazing, not so dense that you practically choke on it, so light and full of flavor. And the teriyaki chicken was OUTSTANDING. Not just your typical "brown teriyaki sauce and rice", this was made with homemade sauce, fresh veggies and really tender chicken. PLEASE TRY THIS PLACE!!
Great atmosphere, awesome sushi and quick service. Brent was amazing, witty and I too of his game. Would come back anytime!
This is an incredible cute place for sushi. I have never been and tried it for the first time and now I'm hooked. Staff polite, and failry fast service!
Ate there last night for the first time. Very pleased with what we had. Seemed pretty authentic to me. Will defiantly return!
First time here. Friendly staff and great sushi. Also cool modern look. Will surely return.
We hadn't been here for a while but the food was excellent. The Tempura was delicious! The sushi rolls had awesome flavors and tasted very fresh. We will be going back soon!

My review is for the regular menu, not the sushi. I go along with my sushi loving boyfriend to sushi bars frequently so I've had my share of "other menu items" at these places. I ordered the teriyaki chicken, it was dry and the sauce was too strong with soy sauce flavor. I ordered green tea and when it came it was separating in the glass and had stuff floating in it. That was an absolute no go. The decor is a dive, which I am normally willing to overlook if the food is good. My boyfriend does love the sushi here and has been going here a long time. So if you're solely in it for sushi, go for it. Otherwise go elsewhere.

We have been here a few times for Family or just to have some lunch. we usually go during lunch happy hour on Friday. I must say it is nice a quiet and love to be able to chat while eating. They do play music on a radio. Sometimes its loud but not too bad. Now Getting to the food. Happy hour. is amazing. the Sushi is filling. just the right amount of food for the cost. The servers is nice and we don't have to wait too long for anything to come to us. if you are looking for an all you can eat, they do not accommodate but we are satisfied with just the happy hour. Great Food hands down.

My son and I popped in for a quick bite to eat this week and what a surprise. Friendly service and the food... so fresh and yummy. I'm excited that my office is just up the road on Higley and Baseline cause I will be stopping in again very soon for lunch. My new favorite place for sushi.   on the money for this one. You'll  it just like we did. Enjoy!!

Great sushi at a great price! I will be a regular as long as they keep the lunch special. I usually place an order for pick up at least twice a week. Try the Philly roll! They put a generous amount of fish on their rolls. I wonder why its so dead every time i go in???

I could live off of sushi and being from Southern California I have had some amazing experiences at different locations and I have had my fair share of experiences of sushi restaurants in scottsdale too. I was a bit weary at first but REALLY impressed after my meal. The Las Vegas Roll is great and the Scallop
 roll was delici!
Love the decor- dark walls with pops of red. Calm environment, great for chatting. The sushi was delicious and very reasonably priced during happy hour. Good service!
Delicious! My favorite was the New York and my Fianc√©'s favorite was the Las Vegas! The service was fast and the food was hot and delicious. Will definitely be coming back
Sushi was great!  Fish tasted fresh and it was prepared well. Service was nice as well. A good go-to neighborhood sushi joint.

I really wanted to like this place since it is so close to where I live. I certainly hope the level of service is not consistently like it was when I was there. Staff did not even apologize for the wait which leads me to believe this is the norm. Took over an hour to bring out 3 rolls of sushi and they didn't even honor the advertised happy hour special. More servers during peak times might help with creating a better experience, but the silver lining is that the sushi is only mediocre.

It kills me to leave a 1-star review for a restaurant that I once called "the best sushi in Arizona". My father I have been coming to Kampai for over 15 years (ever since I was a little girl) and would usually eat here about every other month. The sushi was wonderful and fresh and the staff was friendly and always remembered us. The last time I ate at Kampai (before the change) was in April and the quality was as good as ever, we had our usual blonde spikey haired waitress who was always so sweet and helpful and we had a great time. We had no idea that it would be the last time we would enjoy our meals here
Then the owners changed.
I deeply miss the old owners, and feel they would be deeply disappointed at the state of the restaurant now. We just got back from dinner at Kampai and it was utterly horrible. The quality of the fish was astonishing sub-par and my beloved Tempura Udon was very watery and bland. The octopus, soy beans, tempura shrimp and vegetables, salmon, and yellowtail were all not very good and the Salmon Roe was shriveled and very small, and way too salty.You could tell that they were refilling the bottles of soy sauce was very cheap version that was (again!) salty and terrible. I don't know how a wonderful, traditional Japanese restaurant could sink so low, so fast. The menu was completely different (though they did have some old favorites) featuring orange chicken, egg rolls, and a variety of weird desserts that have never been on the menu before. They also seemed to be "out" of many things we tried to order: agedashi tofu, uni, white meat chicken etc. The bathrooms were filthy, and very weird country/soft rock was playing too loudly in the background. Ugh.
I'm very saddened to say we will never be returning to Kampai again. They say change is good but in this case it definitely wasn't. We'll miss you Kampai.

I love goin here for their lunch bento.
Chicken teriyaki with mixed tempura is my choice 
Every time I go there. 
It's so so good and their service is 5 stars as well as their food.
We had the sashimi combo. Excellent! Good crowd. Mellow atmosphere. Nice neighborhood restaurant. We'll be back

I was driving home on Higley from a dentist appointment and this "Happy Hour" sign caught my eye.  I'm always up for a good Happy Hour for food so I decided to check it out.  The food was good and the people were friendly.  I got the Jalape√±o Poppers (2 pcs), Spicy Tuna Roll (8 pcs), and Philly Roll (8 pcs) from the Happy Hour (4pm-7pm) menu and it came out to $14.  This place was worth the impromptu visit, and I would recommend it.

We have been looking for a good sushi joint close by that is good and not to pricey. I always saw this place but never tried it but saw reviews for its and decided to give it a try. It was great, the best I have had so far. They had a great Hawaiian roll of some sort that was awesome. We basically had a few of their various rolls since we are just beginners at Sushi. We are not hardcore like some but this place did its job and hit the spot. I like the quaint atmosphere and really nice wait staff. It was really dark inside which took a bit for my eyes to get use to :) But all around I loved it.

Not bad.  The restaurant was very casual and seemed very clean.  They have a wall of chop sticks when you first enter.  I think you can buy a pair and just leave them there so you can use the same pair each visit; pretty cool idea.  The customer service seemed a little off though, not that friendly.  For some reason the waitress decided to walk away after taking my boyfriend's order without taking mine.  I guess she thought I wasn't hungry. The food itself was alright.  The sushi wasn't bad, but it wasn't fantastic.  If you want sushi and you're in the area it will do the job, but I wouldn't go out of the way.  I also had the orange chicken which had good texture, but is about as salty as a potato chip, also there wasn't much meat.
This place is great! Good service and the sushi is amazing. Try the ASU roll if your looking for spice and the Hawaiian for sweet. Ask for Colin, he's the best waiter at Sushi Ave.

First look and you think augh how good can this place be after all it's next to an auto parts store.  Well let me tell you it is bar far the best Sushi.  I visit RA a lot because my friend live close by, but then I found Sushi Ave. on a dining reward program and I don't go anywhere else!!  They are attentive, the sushi is FRESH, the plum sangria is amazing, the price is very good compared to how much food you get.  Well worth the visit!!!  If you go often you also get your own set of chop stix which they clean and store up front for the next time you come.  LOVE LOVE LOVE Sushi Ave.!!!!  The only negative thing I might say is the chairs make a horrible noise scraping on the floor every time you move.
Our favorite local restaurant! Great, quick service and the best Japanese food around. Everything always tastes fresh. We'll be back next week!

The sushi chef is amazing! I don't understand why some people don't like this place I guess it depends on what they are comparing it to. The food is excellent and again the sushi chef is the best! I'd give them 10 stars if I could. I will be coming back!
Every time I visit AZ Sushi Ave is a stop on my list. The prices are pretty comparable but the quality is really great! They also have great happy hour drals!
Sushi Ave. is legit! I come here all the time. Delicious authentic sushi at a great price. The sashimi combos are always a great deal.

Sushi ave is my new favorite sushi place!!! They have a love love roll that is awesome!!!!! Don't let the mustard sauce description fool you, it is sweet and ads just the right amount of heat to the roll. The server and sushi chef we had tonight were attentive and able to give on the spot suggestions for sake and some of their more unique sushi rolls. We were given a free poke salad, sake, edamame, and a yummy pineapple desert! The salmon sashimi we had was amazing, along with the two love love rolls we had, the rainbow role, and the cucumber I was in sushi heaven! I will definitely be coming back here!
Great new place we found. Great happy hour prices. My favorite is the 'no leftover' roll. Delicious!

My husband and I came for happy hour. The sushi was good and definitely worth it. Our server was very friendly and attentive and we really appreciated our server's recommendation of the Love Love Roll. 

Definitely will be back!
LOVE this place!  Their speciality rolls are yummy, service is friendly, and they have created an atmosphere of "community."  Highly recommend...

Great rolls with great price!!!
Shrimp tempura is my favorite! The people were professional and I did not have to wait too long for my food. I go there every time I'm in the area, would recommend.

THE END OF AN ERA
What once was the best sushi restaurant in Phoenix is now under new management, and it definitely shows.
They have tried to bring in new rolls similar to those at every other sushi place. They have changed the ingredients in many of their rolls, including the spicy tuna roll and the shrimp tempura rolls, which were the ones that kept us coming back. Kampai was special because it wasn't like every other Scottsdale sushi place, it had the freshest ingredients and the most authentic rolls. Not anymore.

The quality of the ingredients is now very poor compared to what it used to be. The fish is sliced way too thin. The rolls were not as fresh or as tasty even in the slightest. Their spicy tuna roll, which used to have fresh tuna and cucumbers and sprouts, is now made with a mixture of chopped tuna and spices with "Krab" mix. 

They changed their entire staff, which will come back to bite them sooner or later. The new sushi chef was rude, did not want to engage in conversation, and plainly did not acknowledge us. Our order was taken much later than we were ready to give it, and we had to ask for waters. Then, another chef came into the sushi bar area from the back wearing a plain tshirt, not a uniform, and without washing his hands he began to make our food. There were several questionable instances when cleanliness did not seem to be a concern of the sushi chefs. 

Sanitation is major at a sushi restaurant, and so is the food. So is the service. So is the music (which they changed from nice traditional music to soft rock?!). Since all of these things have changed, my family who has been long-time customers of Kampai for the last 15 years will sadly not be returning. Kampai, you just lost some previously dedicated customers. 

At least we went here in May for my birthday before they changed, I wish we knew it would be the last time that we could enjoy our favorites. I don't see how they will stay open for much longer.

I love this place. It's seriously the best sushi I've had at the best prices. There is a huge variety to choose from.  My favorites are the Unagi, Deep Fried, Las Vegas, and Spicy Tuna rolls.  I've never eaten from their regular menu though.  The service is good, the chefs are fast, fun, friendly, and have skill.  It's a family owned place and I believe the head chef(s) are from Japan.  It's got a quaint atmosphere and not trendy in the least.  The prices are EXTREMELY reasonable.  The Miso soup here is perfect as well.  I have eaten there on Friday and Saturday nights which can get busy.  Everytime I go there I see regulars. You can also get the sushi to go which is nice.   

Bottom line, this place is TEN times better than RA as far as quality of sushi goes.  It's not as expensive as Ah So either.  Perfect atmosphere as far as I'm concerned.

Phenomenal happy hour prices and selection,  i had a delicious jalapeno roll.  California was good, but very little avocado, (and only $3).  Service a bit slow,  but friendly.   4 stars, mainly for price.   Offer a $10 discount on next visit when showung them that you reviewed them,  but I didn't take advantage.
The ABSOLUTE best sushi this side of the US 60. Happy hour is from 4-7PM with great prices on some hella good sushi! Thanks sushi avenue!!!!

Great little sushi place. Servers are polite and cheerful. Almost overwhelming selection. We love the sushi rolls, and my kids enjoyed the bento boxes. Delicious chocolate drizzled orange to end the meal. Will return whenever the sushi craving hits!
Nice local place with some interesting rolls you won't get at other places! My favorite was the tiger roll. We also liked their gyoza and tofu appetizer. Great service.. We plan on coming back!
Always fresh. Love the spicy squid and fresh Toro, One of the best local sushi restaurants out there.
Great sushi! I had the spicy tuna fried garlic roll and it might have been the best roll I've ever had. Fast service. Clean place. I would definitely come back again!

If you are looking for a quiet place to enjoy sushi and other Japanese fare, look no further.  We went on a Thursday evening and sat at the sushi bar.  The sushi chef greeted us as we walked in the door.  The place was rather dark, but looked very clean.  There was only one other couple in the restaurant.  

The sushi bar faced 2 flat screen tvs that were playing sports (x games).  The decor was simple, black.  The bar stools are small, IKEA looking seats.  Was worried about staying on mine.  HA.

There is a huge variety of specialty sushi; the Hawaiian was suggested by the waiter, and we ended up eating 2 of them!  We also got the usual CA roll, Philly roll, and salmon.  We also got piping hot salt covered edamame, which was good.  The sushi was okay, the seaweed they use is more chewy than I have ever experienced, didn't have the heart to tell the sushi chef.  The specialty sushi is priced around $12 per roll, the typical sushi (like CA roll) is around $4 per roll.

There were only 6 other people who ate @ the restaurant that night, and although the sushi chef said it picked up @ 6:30 or 7, it never did.  We would return to try some of the other Japanese items on the menu, but not the sushi.

I think what I like most of all about Sushi Ave is Harry and Nana. They have made my experiences so pleasant. Every time Travis and I go to Sushi Ave Nana makes us something special (from her secret menu) and it's ALWAYS delicious! She is working on a secret menu to offer on their Yelp page and I am so excited for it, because everything she gives us is AMAZING!

Their sushi rolls are full of flavor, never have they been soggy, the Vegas roll is SOO good!!! Warm, with a light crisp texture and eel sauce...mmmMmm!

Come, try it out, it really is as good as it gets!!

Groan, moan, sigh. We came here on a Sat night and the restaurant was okay busy but extremely under staffed. 
We were seated asked by one waitress what we wanted to order. When we said we needed more time to look at the menu, she promptly disappeared. I mean, literally. We never say her back in the dining room again. 
There was one sushi chef and one waitress for the whole place. Tick tock, tick tock. It took over 30 mins to order and prob even longer to get our food. 
The worst part was the waitress was pretty rude to us until she saw me check in on Yelp. Instantaneously she was much friendlier and nicer to us.  Pretty suspect!
We still left her a decent tip cause anyone can have an off night . . . But not sure we will be back- the food?  Who can remember- we dozed off while waiting for it!

This is such a cute little sushi spot! I had no idea it was even on the corner of Higley and Guadalupe, but it is definitely a hidden gem. Their happy hour runs from 3-7pm on weeknights, which is perfect for stopping by right after work! The rolls were all delicious, happy hour pricing was about mid-range (but a great deal for the quality of food) and the size of the rolls was not at all stingy. Their rainbow roll was one of the best I've had in the Valley. Also, when the server brings you your check they also give you a little dessert consisting of orange slices with some whipped cream and a chocolate drizzle. Definitely worth a try - I know I will be back!

I love everything I have had here !! I am so going to try dessert next time - it's trying to pick just one .. I brought my daughter tonight she loved it- I normally come with my Best friend !! It's our new favorite !!

Disgusted with the "service" my family and I received tonight. We got there an hour ago and after waiting an hour for food we still didn't get any. I packed up my kids and started walking out and then they finally apologize. My husband is still inside waiting for our food. We got there close to the end of happy hour, so yes we knew it would be busy, but we didn't think we would be forgotten. There were several parties who came after us that had their meals before we even had our drinks. The kids meal came out in 3 minutes. Appetizers....never showed up. Food.....never showed up. I'm so disappointed right now as I really like this place but doubt I'll ever come again after this. Not at all how I wanted to spend my Friday evening. Shame on you Sushi Ave.
A coworker recommended Sushi Ave to me so I came for lunch. The sushi is really good and the prices are great. The jalepeno roll is the best! I'll definitely be back for lunch often.
Cute place very clean. The waitress is a doll and very sweet. Everything we tried was delicious.

When my brother's friend found out where I lived recently, his first reaction was "oh, so you've been to Kampai then?"  My blank look horrified him, and he quickly explained that apparently I have a hidden gem sushi place in my North Phoenix neighborhood -- a "gem" that he referred to as one of the best in the city!  This was a pleasant surprise to me (I guess I should have paid more attention when I drove by that bowling lane strip mall...).

Two words:  GREAT SUSHI!  Seriously up-to-par with my most recent bar-setter, Hana sushi -- except less expensive and much larger portions.  In fact, I had the opposite experience of many of the reviewers here:  our portions were shockingly large, from oversized/fat rolls to a sashimi order that was almost double what I would have expected.  The albacore tataki and Kampai roll were our favorites, but everything we had was fresh and delicious.

The atmosphere leaves something to be desired, depending on your mood.  I was a little caught off-guard by the harsh...errr...bright lighting as well as the lack of noise/energy there on a Friday night.  Of course this can be refreshing compared to the "scene" at a Stingray or Ra.  Our service at our table was fantastic, very attentive and friendly.  

I will definitely be making Kampai a staple in the portfolio, and given that I favored the food over the dining experience, I will certainly consider takeout as well in the future.
Excellent food and service.  Salmon collar is a must.  Suggest trying spicy sizzling pork.  Jalapeno poppers were excellent as well.  Never disappointed.  Best sushi in the valley.
Food was great! Made it 5 min before happy hour ended and the waitress got everything in just in time. The service was outstanding. We will be back again!

Visiting from California and wanted some good sushi. My brother who resides out here brought us to Sushi Ave. I'm so glad we ubered here because the happy hour is amazing!! They have a lunch and dinner happy hour so cheers! Anyways bottom line is Great service, great food, awesome happy hours! Definitely recommend this place!!

Would give 0 stars. Ordered over the phone after viewing website and menu. Strike one when I order ahead of time and go to a restaurant to pick up my order and it's not done. Strike 2 when I checked my bag to leave and all of my food was not in the bag. Strike 3, the plates we ordered were disgusting. 

The spicy tuna we ordered wasn't spicy, and really fishy tasting. Our squid salad also left very much to be desired and was extremely rubbery. I've had better squid salad for a fraction of the price at Teharu (the conveyor belt sushi place). It makes me wonder if they're just cooking up dead animals from the veterinarian's office next door.... The food was seriously that disgusting, I wouldn't be surprised.

Good local place great food! Nice employees. Large party sushi so backed up only 1 sushi chef. Our first time here cost for three people 74 with tip. Next time will come for Happy  hour 5.00 rolls 5.00 sake bombers

Wow great place to eat just came home from dinner.  I've been meaning to try this place for a couple of months now, and finally decided to check it with a friend.  Good atmosphere not noisy at all and a great place for good sushi and a good talk.  Fish quality was good and service was excellent.  Will definitely be back to try the different rolls.

Had the New York, Volcano, and Red Spider alll very tasty

This is the best kept sushi secret in the area! We have been a few other places for sushi but we keep coming back to Sushi Ave. They have so many options and SO many delicious rolls! Our service is always great and they have a fabulous happy hour.

Came with my husband who's not the biggest fan of sushi, but I love it! And this place did not disappoint!! Everyone was friendly and nice, very welcoming and helpful and also informative. Food was excellent!!! Will definitely be coming here on a regular basis from now on!!! Special thanks to Colin for great service!

Hit up Sushi Ave on a Sat night, I lucked out and got the parking spot right in front! As soon as we walked in my wife and I were greeted by a server. She sat us at a table right int he middle along the wall. The place wasn't packed, but not empty, just the right amount of folks to instill confidence that this was a good place. By the time we were done with our meal, 3-4 parties had been seated. They had a TV on which had college football on, yes!

The menu is pretty big, filled with many specialty rolls they have created. I tried the ASU Roll, Crunchy California, Shrimp Tempura, and Super Philly. All were good. The ASU Roll is similar to the Arizona Roll at House Modern Sushi, spicy sauce, and a jalepeno on top. It wasn't that hot flavor wise (maybe my headcold had something to do w/ that). The Super Philly is close to what they serve at Orient on Elliot, I added my own sriracha to it to up the flavor. My wife is pregnant so she had most of the cali and shrimp tempura roll, she had been craving some sushi and left me to eat the rolls w/ uncooked fish.

Got edamame, came out nice and hot, not one cold bean and just the right amount of salt on top. I had some hot tea, it was okay, not sure what the blend was but something green. 

Service was attentive, got refills without having to flag someone down, and the food was brought out quickly after ordering since we beat the rush. With our bill, we also got an orange cut in half w/ some whipped cream and chocolate syrup, with two toothpicks to cleanse the palate. Enjoy when places do that, not all of them do. The owners (what I believe to be the owners) said "thank you!" loudly when we got up after eating. Glad to see we're noticed and they seemed to care about our business.

Loved the music here - they were playing some cover songs of modern pop tracks which was fun.

Will definitely be back since its pretty close to home.
Better than ever!  Fresh, delicious fish.  A variety of unique rolls.  I enjoyed the Maui roll and Super White Tuna sashimi.  Friendly staff.  Good prices.  High standards.  I'll be back... Often.
This place has fantastic sushi come here at least once a month such fantastic service
First time here! Great vibe and the food was delicious. We devoured 5 rolls, two orders of potstickers and coconut shrimp.  Great prices and friendly service in a convenient location.

Pro - FRESH, sushi is delicous, service is good.  You get to store your own chopsticks-  catchy.  Hopefully nobody licks them while your away. 

Con - Nit picky but the bottom of the chairs need those soft thingys.  Everytime some sits - SCREEEEECH.   

The weird stuff in the jars are not all that.  Wont do that again. 

The lobster roll was awesome.

Another Sushi place that is owned by Koreans lol. The staff including the waitress and sushi chef were nice and service was good. But it was quite empty that day (just two tables including ours) so maybe that was the reason. Anyways, ordered salmon and scallop nigiri which were both good. The fish tasted fresh. No complaints here!

Then ordered some rolls: spicy roll (forgot name), rainbow, caterpillar, and alaskan. Again, the fish were fresh, but I gotta say, I wasn't a big fan of the alakan roll. Originally, I thought the lemon on it would add a nice zing, but It kinda overpowered everything. On the other hand, I would recommend the rainbow and caterpillar roll if you like a bunch of sushi and eel. (eel cause=bomb). 

Now on to my rant of this place. I guess it's not meant to be a negative but just a warning to those with bigger or hungry stomachs. This place has the TINIEST rolls ever. I swear the pictures of rolls on the menu are the actual size of the rolls. You eat one and you don't even feel it sitting in your stomach. I actually asked the waitress which of the rolls were the biggest. lol 

So yea, there you have it. It's a nice sushi place with fresh fish and good staff, but if you want value and bigger portions, I would look else where.

Big fan of Katsu Chicken and japanese food so I thought I'd give this place a try. The Katsu Chicken was awesome! It was a tad bit well done but was still really good. The sushi had a really good quality to it and they were fast so serve us. Would recommend this place!

This place is really good!! The inside design is really nice and comfy, won't fit a lot of people though. I'm not a BIG sushi fan, but they have everything you need and more which I like. I had their tempura udon and it's really good, the soup base is delicious (not too salty). My friends ordered the sushi rolls and they were so good as well. I really like their California rolls. Our server was really nice too. Definetely will come again!! Might be our new sushi place!
Amazing definitely would recommend this place!!! Worth every penny. Great atmosphere and friendly staff. Food was great and fresh.

This really could have been a 5star and I will go back to give it a chance. Great food. I went at 5:20 on a Friday Eve which was perfect timing. Within 20 minutes, place was full. They had a happy hour menu with great priced rolls. I also got a special roll. The happy hour rolls were fabulous! The special roll was good. I got teriyaki chicken for the kids. This dish was good. They missed out on 5 stars because of wait times. They are hiring. Also, I had requested two refills for sodas but was brought one. "The other still has soda" which was odd. Great food, great price. Will try a different special next time.
This place has the best sushi in the East Valley the sushi is very fresh and tasty. I highly recommend it.

Sushi Ave has the best happy hour for a sushi restaurant, I'm sold on that. The happy hour menu is delicious and the large sake is only $3. We love their ASU roll, double spicy, jalapeno roll, etc. The list goes on and on. 

The only reason I took off one star is because we never knew who our server was. We would get our food an that was the only time we were able to quick restaurant a drink or another roll and it was never the same person. It was so chaotic and they were all just running around.  Once they figure out a routine, it will be as god as it gets for a sushi restaurant in this area.
Our waitress was very kind! However, the food was mediocre at best. I would equate it with the sushi you can buy pre-made at a grocery store.
The best sushi happy hour in town! The New York roll is delicious and so unique! Good service and great food, just can't be beat! You won't regret coming here!
Great food. Great hot saki to warm the inners. Great service and the happy hour has rocking prices.

Love this place! They have a very long happy hour and a good happy hour menu. Took a star off only because some rolls are too big for one bite, maybe that's a personal problem  Overall, it's a great place, clean, fast service with a smile, and great sushi.

The rolls are really good. Have been to many sushi places where the rolls were already prepared and frozen, but at this place the chef was preparing the rolls to order. Visited this place during the happy hour and the pricing is really good! The ambience is pretty good too.

Sushi Ave has been me and my girlfriends spot since we were in 9th grade. We have taken our chances other places and nothing hits the spot quite like Sushi Ave. the service is almost as good as the sushi and the crab jalape√±o poppers were the most amazing things I've ever had in my life. Definitely worth the stop.

Great food , TERRIBLE wait! Its been almost an hour and we still haven't got our appetizers! We thought about leaving but we already waisted an hour! So if you have hours to spare, this is the place to come waist it! #hangry
We come here every weekend. Great sushi, great prices, and friendly staff. We always recommend this place to friends!
Pricing is very good! Extremely low prices for high quality sushi. Food is excellent but service is a bit slow. If you are in a hurry for a work lunch could get stressful.

The rolls are good, but they have a hard time getting your order right when you call in for carry out. I always order the same thing and they continually get it wrong to the point that I have started to just get different items because I know they will give me a "spicy salmon roll when I asked for a spicy salmon bowl" 
Over all they are good just don't call in
First time here and I was not disappointed!! We got the White Christmas, the Maui Roll and the Monkey Brain. It was so good!! It also came with a complimentary fruit dessert.

If I could give it 4.3 stars I would. Excellent, clean, serving sizes are average and prices for sushi are maybe slightly below average. Which is great. Happy hour just isn't during the week. Make it there on Saturday between 11am and 2pm and get special prices. Although I do believe they make up for it with smaller than average sushi servings. Still, one can't deny it is one of the better places in the Phoenix areas.
Great service and excellent food. I get great service every time and it comes a good price. Food never late and the restaurant is never busy. A good quiet restaurant.
My family loves this place it is our favorite sushi restaurant. The food is great, The Price is Right, and the service is great but very nice employees.
Love the sushi here...especially at their Happy Hour prices. The other food is OK, not wonderful. The hot tea had a funny taste...not what we are used to. However, this is our go-to for sushi.
Ordered a bento pox and a jalape√±o pot sticker the last time I was here and here ordering it now. It was great.  I've eaten this quality of food only in San Francisco. Will be back again soon.

There's nothing you can do to not give this sushi stop 5 star!  The aesthetics, service and food are all traditional, spot on and wonderful.  I have gone here several times with friends on many occasions and its always been a hit.  The sushi is amazing and honest.  It's a good fix when your away from the ocean and it passes up some of the places I've eaten on the ocean coast.  Anything you get here whether it's the sushi or the grill will impress.  The deserts are also pretty rad as well and I love it that they keep everything traditional and rooted.  If you want to try something amazing and semi exotic get the Kama - Yellowfin Collar.  FREAKING STELLAR!!  Rice and grilled fish brings me right back down to the roots.

I would look at your bank statement a few weeks after going here. I went here about a month ago they charged me that day and just checked my bank statement and they charged another 20 dollars to my card 2 days ago and that wasn't anywhere near my tab or tip.

Stopped in for lunch today with the family.  We were very pleased with how good the food was.  Sushi was fresh the rolls were nice sized and the Salmon was very tasty.  Their sashimi portions could be a bit more generous but outside of that very nice.
The hot food and appetizers were  great.  If you want an amazing appetizer go for the Spicy Garlic Edamame, or their cucumber salad.  We will definitely be back.

I've been twice now and this place ranks with Ra as being top nasty sushi place. People that rate a place on rolls should not comment on "freshness". Rolls are for people that eat sushi to be cool. Eat the sashimi and then rate. Anyways, had the large sashimi plate. Fish was warm, not on ice and the albacore about made be puke. It's easy to dress up bad fish with rice and sauces but not sashimi. Fish was glossy and opaque......... Never again!!
Great happy hour, always delicious and on or above par with sushi places of similar price and style.  Service always seems to be just a bit of a struggle.

Warm sushi, unorganized service, warm beer...... need I say more. The rolls were a quarter size if smaller & warm when they shouldn't have been. The price you pay for the smallest of rolls was RIDICULOUS!!!! The inside of the egg rolls were still frozen..... we all know that means they cooked them hot & fast, not slow & warm. $70 for 2 people to eat w/1 of us having 1 beer is insane!!!!! Not sure how this place has stayed open unless people enjoy blowing money of poor poor sushi. YUCK!
Great Vegas rolls and miso soup is delicious. They have great lunch specials from 11-2. My husband tried their orange chicken "box meal" and it was delicious.

Simply... WOW!!  The menu has expanded, and the food is even better under the new owners!  Presentation, portion size, and freshness are all 5 stars.  And the service?  A++!!!  I am a big foodie (cooked with Barbara Fenzl on Channel 8), so don't give high praise unless it REALLY is that good.  My favorite sushi/sashimi in the valley (and not paying snobby Scottsdale prices).

We ordered sushi from Sushi Ave to take home so I can not rate the service for eating at the restaurant. We got five rolls: Caterpillar, Tiger, Ultimate Rainbow and some with avocado. I wasn't crazy about the latter (it was good, just not my taste) but the others were really great. The only thing I didn't like was that one roll (I think it was one with eel) had a noticeable butane gas taste, maybe they used a butane gas torch to char the fish. The rest of the roll was so delicious that I still ate it though. I take one star off for this and the fact that it is a bit too pricey in my opinion, to be really satisfied you need at least two rolls and that costs you a good $20-30 here. I still recommend this place and would definitely come again.

Disclaimer: my last visit was at least 9 months ago; I have no idea what it's like now with a new owner, but prospects don't look good: Love this place! It doesn't look like much from the outside, but the food is fantastic! The wait staff is very nice & accommodating. Everything tastes so fresh and comes out quickly! It's excellent & one of our favorite places to eat!

Sushi Ave is fantastic! This place is by far my favorite Sushi place in the valley. The crazy lobster roll, tropical roll, and ASU roll are especially delicious. I've never had anything on the menu that I didn't like. The service is always great and the staff is very friendly. The happy hour is also very fun and affordable!
Extremely friendly and attentive service.  The Red Dragon roll was very good and the Shishito peppers were awesome.  They also have a decent Happy Hour.

Kampai is in a really crappy strip mall, and the establishments around it look really shady. However, I have nothing but great things to say about Kampai. My daughter and I usually go on friday evening around 6, and the service is great. The staff is very friendly and the fried oysters are delicious! They have some very unique rolls if you look over the menu, of on the chalk board above the bar. I enjoy taking my 9 year old here for dinner, it is not an over crowded hipster place which is a releif. It has a quiet atmosphere where you can sit and enjoy your meal and the company with you.
We finally found a sushi place to call "ours". My favorite is the calamari roll. Yum!

We were really excited to try this place. We were seated pretty quickly and the sushi was good. What made this experience bad was the lack of customer service. My boyfriend ordered the teriyaki chicken without vegetables and Brent, our waiter, brought out the teriyaki chicken not made to our order, so we kindly asked for it to be remade without the vegetables. What was disappointing is that we waited 22 minutes to get to remake of the teriyaki chicken and after eating our food, we waited another 19 minutes to get our check. On top of this, our waiter Brent didn't check in on us once we asked him to have our teriyaki chicken made (duration of 41 minutes). It felt like he was intentionally ignoring us because he never came back to our table and asked us how our food was, etc. 

In conclusion, I would recommend this place for the sushi, but as far as the customer service goes, the employees need some training.

I LOVE sushi! I have seen this restaurant before but never had time to stop in, today I did just that. It was excellent, not only the service but the prices and the food were excellent. If I could give it 10 stars I would. High five Sushi Ave!!! I'll be back!

This is my GO-TO sushi place. There is a nice atmosphere, and it has a really nice mix of different Asian foods (I've seen people complaining, but they have definitely always played Korean music) and I think this greatly benefits them. There is something for everyone. Their lollipop roll is my favorite fried roll, and we always have to order the salmon nigiri. It seems pricey, but it's all worth it. If you're not a fan of sushi, their noodles are delicious. I have also ordered the chicken katsu (a personal favorite). The bento boxes are a good place to start if you are completely overwhelmed (everything you can order for these I have learned are all very delicious, come with a protein, sticky rice, Asian salad, and miso soup). I would definitely recommend the yakisoba. 

All in all, I think they're a generally good restaurant. Maybe not if you're looking for strictly Japanese, but you will receive quality (so much better than Ra and many other local places) and its family owned. A nice place to relax and talk. I always leave satisfied.

I absolutely LOVE sushi ave! Not only is the service and staff fantastic,but the food is AMAZING!!!! I come here as often as i possibly can. I'm crazy about the hawaiian chicken and the las vegas rolls. The happy hour menu couldn't be any more perfect,either. It has everything on their that I normally get at a great price!!!! While others are blinded by the trendiness of other "sushi" resturaunts, such as RA sushi, i'm enjoying QUALITY food by chefs who put their heart into every plate they make. I would reccomend this place to anyone and EVERYONE! SUSHI AVE YOU ROCK!

The rolls and cocktails were super good. My boyfriend and I love sushi and it was great to know that there's a place nearby us that serves good quality Japanese food. The staff accommodated us even though we arrived at almost 9pm which is the restaurant's closing time. Definitely coming back to try more rolls!

Saw positive reviews for Sushi Avenue and decided to stop by and try Sushi Avenue.  The employees there are very nice and care about their customers.  The Food is the best!!  I had Octapus and fresh water eel sushi as well as their Teryaki Chicken plate.  I would deffinetly suggest going.

Good Sushi, the Dynamite roll was really fishy tasting, and the Vegas roll was much better.  Small restaurant, does not have the Japanese ambiance.  Service was great for the first sushi roll we ordered and super slow on the second one, and we ordered the rolls at the same time.
Happy hour is for a full 24 hours a day which was great.  We spent $23.00 on two rolls, Kirin and Sake.

I continue to enjoy coming back to this little place in our neighborhood. This isn't the best Japanese restaurant in the world, but the food is good and plentiful, and the service has always been very good each time. I haven't came here in Happy Hour. However I guess it'll be crowded that time with a good price Happy Hour Menu. 

The place was quite, small, and a bit dark/dim. ... but there are fine display like the personalized chop sticks, sake display and stone corner. ...

I did had Nabe Yaki Udon, Dragon Roll and Spicy Tuna. It's so good to me. I'm really addicted to their sushi.
Very good sushi!!! Great ambiance, server was very nice. Rainbow roll legit. Happy hour prices are fantastic.  Clean place to eat. Happy to find this place. Thank you Yelp.
Always delish! Nice Happy Hour options! Yum! Sushi Ave is my favorite sushi spot. Rainbow roll and Las Vegas rolls rock and don't forget the sake!

AMAZING. I don't really know what else I can say, it doesn't get much better than Sushi Ave!
They have a wonderful selection of their own unique Specialty rolls with all kinds of crazy ingredients, and the menu has gorgeous pictures of every one of them! Every ingredient is fresh and top-quality. They have THE best salmon sashimi i have had in AZ - EVER. The service is always wonderful with pleasant staff and owners, and the restaurant has great ambiance. The only negative is that every time I go in it is under-staffed and I have to wait a long time - but the quality of food is well worth the wait. I am a huge fan of Sushi Ave!
The new owners should have realized if its not broken, dont fix it. They changed the entire menu from what was Kampai and now Sushi ave is an Indian restaurant.

We absolutely lobe it here. We come as often as possible! The service is great, and the food is amazing, and fresh! We have been coming here for over 4 years! Thank you, for being a great local sushi hangout for our family!

I have heard of Kampai long before I started Yelping, why it took me so long to go I haven't a clue!  

The restaurant is basically a sushi bar with a dining room attached...no emphasis on the dining room part.  The sushi bar is large enough to fit quite a few people though!  We were seated in the dining area.

Just to test the "waters" my wife and I ordered just tetaki, assorted sushi and a few traditional rolls.  I must say it was probably the most professionally handled, freshest fish I have eaten in Phoenix.  I don't know who the owner is, but he knows his stuff!!  Helps that we went on a Thursday (if anyone has read Kitchen Confidential, you know what I mean).

We will be back for more!  My only gripe is our server barely understood english and I don't speak Japanese.  She missed on 2 orders of sushi, forgot one  and brought us something we didn't order.  Another server tried to serve us a few plates that another table ordered.  Was pretty funny though when the table guests saw me playfully reaching for their plate with my chopsticks!

This is one "character of a restaurant", if you can put up with the quirks your in for some food!
Delicious! Happy hour prices are amazing! Our new favorite sushi restaurant. We will be back!!! Try the Ultimate California Roll!

As I sit here and wait for the server to come take our order,  I'm a bit annoyed. I was ready to order with my drinks and was told to "wait!".  There are 12 people here now (3 tables) at dinner service and she's running around crazy.  

I sit at the sushi bar thinking we could be served faster, not the case.  

We Ordered the $16.95 dinner combo (beef bugolgi, sushi,  mixed tempura) and a couple of appetizers.  Let's see if they can gain my confidence with the food because this server is going nuts. 

The food was good just unfortunately we caught them on a bad night of no servers
Fast and very friendly staff! Great happy hour prices. Tootsie Roll sushi was amazing!

I can't sleep on these folks! I stopped in here for lunch today... interesting story...

'Lunch' for me usually just means 'any meal I eat before 7pm'. Often my mid-day meals fall around 2-5pm, and that is a TOUGH time to get into restaurants. Most everything is closed between lunch and dinner. Not these good folks, though... is it wrong that I almost gave them five stars for that alone...??

So anyhow, I stopped by here at about 3:30pm, and my first impression was that it was a nice little spot. So I saddled up to the sushi bar and took a look at their offerings. Pretty typical fare, and pretty much what you'd expect from XYZ Sushi establishment. Nothing overly surprising, but a decent menu nonetheless. So I ordered a few bits of sashimi, a few cuts of nigiri-zushi, and of course my salmon skin rolls. Everything was really good! Looks like they have a decent selection of sake, and a LOT of home-made infused sake as well. The service was prompt and attentive, everyone was friendly, and the sushi was damned tasty. I was impressed that they serve ama-ebi, and even fry up the head for you. The ikura was equally tasty, and all of the sashimi that I ordered was generous, with a nice heap of daikon.

The salmon skin rolls were top-notch. I liked the little bit of spicy sauce that they put in there, it added a nice little zing.

All in all, this was a solid place. I like the fact that they're open pretty much all day, and they're close to the gym I work out at. I can't really 'rave' about their sushi, because they didn't have a lot of the stuff that I really jam out on (toro, uni, iwashi, etc). What I *CAN* say is that that won't stop me from coming back here after a workout for a quick lean-protein fix. :)

It makes me sad to write this, because Sushi Ave used to be my favorite. Unfortunately, we had a pretty bad experience on our last visit. 

Someone must have called in sick, because they were SEVERELY under-staffed. There was one waiter for the entire restaurant (poor guy), and he had a difficult time balancing all the tables. We waited a long time to place our order, and an even longer time for our food. 

They've changed the menu to include different Asian cuisines, such as Bul-Ko-Gi (Korean) and Orange Chicken (Chinese). I think a Japanese restaurant should stick to serving quality Japanese food, but my husband wanted to try the Bul-Ko-Gi. I got the Chirashi Sushi bowl, and we ordered a Spicy Tuna Roll to share. 

My husband got his food first. We decided to share it, since it didn't seem like my food was coming any time soon. We finished his plate, and then the roll came out. We finished the roll, waited some more, then my food came out. Our waiter was never able to check on us or refill our waters. 

The food was mediocre. The fish wasn't as fresh as I remembered. It certainly wasn't worth the long wait. 

I won't be returning to Sushi Ave. I'll go to Sakana in Mesa instead.

Decided to try a new sushi place, found this one on Yelp. Yelp has never let me down, this place was awesome! I unfortunately had to order it to go, but the woman on the phone was very helpful and nice. To-go Sushi isn't always the best, but their rolls were amazing. When I showed up she just had them packed up, paid super quick and I was out the door. I really like their restaurant, its decorated really different than other Sushi places. They have their own style and a very regulars vibe. I cant wait to take my fiance back so we can dine-in.
Sushi Ave is my all time favorite sushi restaurant. We've travelled all over the US and this is by far the best sushi I've had. We're so glad we found this gem!!!

Ok so although Im tempted to give this place a 1 star, I will be fair and give them 2 because their sushi is always fresh, that is if you have a few hours to wait for it to arrive, with that being said, that is my biggest complaint. I moved to phoenix 5 years ago, this was the 1st place my husband took me to, and I loved it, the sushi was amazing (although their menu is very limited and boring) and their mussels are the best in the valley, they dont stuff it with crab meat, like the other places we went to. However within the past few years, their service has declined tremendously, their host  looks like a kid who does not know much about greeting customers, most of the time looks confused, I havent seen more than 2 servers working on their busiest nights, which ofcourse is a very big problem. We used to like this place also because its pretty close and we thought it would be a convenient location for a quick stop, well that is absolutely not the case, we went there a few days ago, which is definitely our last time, my husband and I had to wait 45 minutes just to get edemame (soybeans), then 30 min later we received our appetizer, now maybe some people dont mind, but I have 2 kids at home and I dont have all the time in the world on a weekday to sit at a sushi spot for 3 hours just to eat dinner. I was so irritated, the server kept apologizing, and ofcourse i know its not his fault, he was waiting for the chefs to prepare our sushi, but they looked like they were in no rush, taking their time chatting away with people sitting in the bar area. The waiter then told me that if we sat at the bar, we would be served sooner, which is complete bullshit, I go to dinner with my husband to enjoy dinner and talk with my husband and not sit at the bar watching them make my sushi, i like my privacy once in a while considering I have 2 little kids at home!!! So 2 hours into dinner we asked for the check before they could finish our 2 last rolls, my husband paid and we left, what a horrible experience, I dont think i was ever that irritated in a restaurant.

This place is AMAZING!!!! If you are a true sushi fan (I mean real authentic sushi not an all deep fried and CA roll person) you will not be disappointed with this establishment. Throughout the dinner I was given multiple things on the house! Score! I also discovered my all time favorite sushi roll the love love roll!!! This is the best kept secret in phoenix! This place has a normal happy hour Monday-Friday 3-6, and a reverse happy hour from 8- close. There are multiple specials that they offer including a sake tasting for $10. I will definitely be coming back here! And encourage anyone to give it a try you will not be disappointed!!!!
Food was good, the service was terrible!!! And slow, I'd come back for the food just let me serve myself
Food is always good and so are the prices. Service however is slow. They have a great happy hour on sushi!

I can't really say much because nothing happened.  LoL, literally nothing.  I came inside, wasn't sure if you seat yourself or wait for a hostess. There was no sign and nobody came to the front. 

So I sat myself at the sushi bar. Sat for about 15 minutes, nobody helped me, glanced in my general direction, I didn't even see a menu available at the bar. 

I was pretty frustrated (due to my hunger) so I left and went somewhere else.  First time here, it was only half full and I read such good reviews.  I'll give it a 2nd chance next time...
Pretty great place. My wife and I eat here often and I love the ASU roll and the coconut shrimp. They also have great prices, especially during happy hour!
This is my go to when I have a sushi craving. The sushi has always been fresh and delicious. Come during happy hour, the prices can't be beat.

This is my go to place. Sushi is always great and has a true neighborhood feel. 
Best happy hour specials as well. 
Been coming here for years. 
Only sushi bar for me.

Ordered the "Love Love Roll" to try something different, no rice, it was my favorite roll by far of the 3 I ordered. Ordered the "red caterpillar" it was alright, not a ton of flavor and the jalape√±os were super hot. "Volcano roll" was good and what you'd expect. The "love love roll" will have me coming back for sure. Spent $37. 
They also brought me out some orange slices for dessert.

Great little place in an out of the way shopping area. Easy to get in and out if your on lunch break. Nice lunch specials and don't forget the FREE appetizer deal here on Yelp! Fresh sushi, fast and friendly staff. A solid choice.
Second time here and I'm full and very satisfied. So fresh. Quite the selection of rolls as well. Tgis will be my go to sushi place in Gilbert.
Love this place.  It is small and kind of a hidden jewel.  Amazing Happy Hour and good drink prices.  We come here often and my favorites are the Jalape√±o Roll and the Sashimi.
This is mine and my wife's favorite sushi place around. The spicy edamame is our go to and everything else we have had is excellent!

This is the worst place in arizona don't ever come here you will regret it waste of time and money believe me . I'd rather eat my dogs food . Horrible service the one lady I saw is a bitch she doesn't have any kind of customer service
Place is solid always.  We moved from the area and recently just dropped in.  And it is still delicious!  Service was great, and atmosphere hasn't changed laid back and clean.

Sushi Ave has a good happy hour and the quality of sushi is always good! It is a good place in Gilbert for families...they let repeat customers keep chop sticks on the wall for future visits :-)

Recommended!!

I am not recommending Kampai any longer. Stay away.

I used to eat here a fair bit. At that time the place next door wasn't a karate studio, but a tropical fish store - at least as appropriate, maybe moreso. Kampai Sushi used to be good, I just haven't been to Kampai for quite a while - several years, in fact. Yesterday it was very so-so, in fact below par. The prices are not good, since they are priced as single pieces, & this is the only time I have ever seen sushi served in single piece servings. At $2.50 per piece, it matches the $5 per order (2 pieces) you pay everywhere else. The rice was not tightly packed, and the Tamago (egg) was tasteless. The Hamachi (Yellowtail), usually my favorite also lacked taste, and the eel may not have been too fresh - not actually turned bad yet, but not as fresh as it could have been. Either way, SOMETHING I ate there made my stomach go topsy-turvy & made me feel quite ill. Needless to say, I now know why it's been so long since I have been to Kampai, and it will be a lot longer before I return. Oh, and the owner is still the same guy, and he's a miserable so-and-so, I have never seen a frown which would make such a big grin if it were turned upside-down! My wife was the one who spotted that the eel didn't seem to be as fresh as it should be, though she didn't get sick.

We love Sushi Ave!! Their rolls are imaginative, Large & delicious! My favorite thing on the menu are the crab jalape√±o poppers... they're also BIG!!
