Happy Hour is inexpensive & has a large assortment menu of starters, rolls & sushi. We will come back again & again... it's our favorite sushi place!!

Live close by and figured we would give it a try. Very pleased with the atmosphere and the food! Service was fantastic and fast! The quality of the food surprised me with how fresh it was. I would highly suggest anyone that's a sushi connoisseur to give this place a try. We will definitely be back!
My first visit here and loved it. Very tasty! I appreciate that they don't feel the need to pipe in loud club music.
This place has a great happy hour with great prices. I live right down the street so its nice to have a good place that is convenient.

I'll never eat here again!!! I've never been treated like this by wait staff. I had a groupon and I ordered $50 worth of sushi on the FULL PRICE menu and they would not allow me to use the groupon bc it was during happy hour. Again, I ordered from the full price menu. They just totally ripped me off!!!! I'm still so upset over the way I was treated. I'm going through groupon (who is great to deal with) to get refunded for my groupon I wasn't able to use. Very rude!!! Rip off!!!

Was craving sushi and wanted to try a new place.  It was average.. nothing special.  It's a bit pricey too for the quality.  Happy hour seems to have some decent prices though.  I ordered a beef tataki which is normally raw beef... we got some cooked up korean bbq pieces which threw me off, don't get me wrong it was good.  The sashimi: salmon & ono (white tuna) two cuts that are usually melt in your mouth perfection.. kinda chewy? Dragon roll is at most average.  Spent too much for what I got.

Sushi Ave is within a mile of my house and I have probably driven past it a thousand times, I do not know why we have not tried this hidden gem sooner, maybe it was their location in a strip mall with a Checker Auto parts and a veterinary clinic. I'll admit I am not as adventurous when it comes to sushi places as I should be but the cooked stuff tasted really good. We tries their California roils, Spicy Crab rolls, Las Vegas Roll and some sort of "volcano" dish (All I know is they lit it on fire at the table, COOL!). This place is awesome.
Not a bad place in central Phoenix. Size and quality were good and friendly staff. I would recommend you give Sushi Ave a try.

Slowest service ever! Third time coming here and the other two times it has been slow (non-happy hour time) but they did have a "help wanted" sign out. Two months later decided to try again during happy hour. I sat for OVER an hour and noticed a party, seated 45 mins AFTER me, receive their soup and appetizers. I then asked for my soup and within minutes I got it. The sushi is good but services are horrible. I do understand that there would be a wait for sushi during this time but to have to ask for my soup, after seeing someone seated after me served,is disappointing.

Sushi Ave is our favorite place to come for sushi and sake! My husband and I have been coming here for 3 years and have loved every meal. 

Heather is the best. She has such a fun personality and has always been so friendly. She's one of the reasons we keep coming back. 

They have a wall of chopsticks for patrons which we found really fun.
Sushi Ave is the bomb! The New York roll is fantastic and cheap! Definitely making another trip to higley and Guadalupe

This place is amazing it. The only place I've been to that can compare to it's sushi quality is Shimogamo, and Kampai is MUCH cheaper. Weather you want some basic rolls and nigiri or more "exotic" dishes its always fresh and delicious. All the non-sushi menu items I've had were also great. Their katsu is flavorful and succulent, some of the best I've had, although the portion isn't as large as some places.

I'd like to talk a little about the service because I'm surprised by all the bad reviews for it. First, if you sit at the sushi bar I think you can expect amazing service and a fun experience. Second, the table staff is a little less attentive, but in my opinion at most authentic asian restaurants you usually have to make eye contact or motion to them when you want something. I think its a culture thing, they don't like to "interrupt" your meal. 
Finally, it's surprising to see how many people complain about the time it takes to get their sushi or how they had to wait 10 more minutes for their carry out. I've never been to a GOOD sushi place where rolls don't take somewhat forever unless you're the only one there. These people who are so concerned about time that they'd give this place a bad review should try Kona or RA, I'm sure their crappy quick sushi will be to your liking.

But if you're looking for top quality at a reasonable price... then relax, enjoy a hot sake and prepare for a flavorful treat. Kampai!(cheers)

This place is great! I ordered the Dynamite roll during Happy Hour and it was fantastic!
My wife had the Salmon Box lunch and couldn't get enough of the salmon.

The Edamame was great. Will be coming here again!

This is the first time that we have been at sushi Avenue as a family. Every piece of sushi we ordered was fantastic! Can hardly wait to come back again and bring our friends. Highly recommend the ultimate California, the Las Vegas bowl, and be dynamite roll! You won't be disappointed.

Been here twice and both times I thought both times the value for the money was great.  The happy hour and lunch specials will keep me coming back.  Awesome Vegas roll.  I judge all sushi restaurants by the Vegas roll! We also had sashimi and spicy tuna roll which were great!

What a sad day it is when the BEST sushi place in Phoenix is now possibly the WORST!  

New ownership, super unfriendly, awful sauces, the light soy sauce is NOT light but they have it in a light jar and limited sashimi and awful rolls.  No special's, no unique fish, NOTHING about this place is Kampai!!!

Don't waste your money!!!
Had a bad experience with the oysters.

My husband and I have been going here for almost 15 years every spring training and this last time was very disappointing.  I absolutely LOVED the mussels, until now.  Don't know what happened, but something changed in the way they make them, blah...  Nothing about the rolls stood out, some were too big to eat in one bite, fish was fresh, just not too creative.  I hope they find their edge again.
The service was awesome though.  We were in the back with a group that included 2 young children and we got alot of attention.
We love the calm atmosphere.  Jalape√±o poppers are great!   Premise but fried to perfection.  Love the fresh sashimi.  Nice flavored sakis.  Sweet server.

I came here for my birthday, and the staff was super nice. The service was amazing ! The sushi is super yummy ! I love the detail they use on their presentation. Super cute atmosphere and I also got a yummy cheese cake for my birthday gift. Very satisfied over all ! I definitely recommend it !

It's the best sushi I've had in Mesa!

The place is a little pricey, but its one of the better places to eat sushi in the Valley.

What I got:
Lollipop Roll. Rating: 3.5/5
Volcano Roll. Rating: 4/5

The Volcano Roll was pretty good - they set it on fire and I was in awe! The lollipop roll was surprisingly good! I came here with a total of five people, so its good for an intimate setting or to talk with a small group of people. 

I'll probably come back to eat here. I definitely recommend this place to eat if you're in Mesa and looking for a Sushi place to eat at.
You should definitely check this place out! The portions are really good and the rolls are really good! The fish was very fresh and good!! The environment is very nice too.
This place was good, but just good. Happy hour sucks bad and the sushi rolls could be bigger for the price you are paying but over all the sushi was very good .

Took my friend here tonight, awesome sushi, so fresh, love this place!!! Red caterpillar roll, red lobster roll, even the veggie rolls are exceptional.  Reasonably priced, great service everyone is friendly and accommodating.

The place is bigger than you would think.  The sushi was ok.  Service could have been better.  Their water tasted like it was unfiltered tap.  They have a wall full of chopsticks with Patron's names which I thought was interesting.  On each table was a note that if you show your server a Yelp review that you would get $10 off the next visit.  I tried this local restaurant and now it's time to move on.

Being in the desert, you wouldn't believe that such amazing sushi can exist. we've been coming here for the past couple of years, and in my humble opinion it's the best sushi in the valley... maybe the state. the entree menu (non-sushi) is just as delectable! they also have this cute loyalty program were you can get your own personal chopsticks, and they make a display with it!
Very friendly staff. Food was good. But pricey but maybe I'm not used to sushi prices yet. Presentation was great, cane it on a boat plate. We missed happy hour but it looked life good deals.
Me and my lady had a good experience there. The fish was fresh. She enjoyed the Orange chicken. I think a little high on the price. Over all good place.

Was hungry & looking for a quick bite. Stopped at Sushi Ave and they had happy hour. Ordered Shrimp Shumai as an app & then the Crazy Lobster Roll, Spicy Tuna, and house wine for $25. Fresh fish and delicious. I like these little sushi cafes way better than Kona or RA!! Highly recommend the Lobster Roll!!

Stopped in here on a Saturday afternoon for a quick bite.  They offered the happy hour menu, and we got the super white tuna nigiri and the New York roll.  Tasty!  We posted on Instagram so they gave us a free mochi ice cream.

First time at Sushi Ave and I was very impressed!! I moved here from Montana and let me just say, the sushi there isn't even comparable to the sushi at Sushi Ave. Not only was the sushi amazing, but the service and cleanliness of the place was outstanding as well. I will definitely be back for more!

My wife and I have tried several sushi restaurants since moving to Gilbert earlier this year and none compare in quality or service to Sushi Ave. We love it here, and refer it to as "our place". They should honestly be the number one rated sushi restaurant in the Gilbert, Chandler, Mesa area.

You can't beat their happy hour specials... Best sushi in the valley of the sun!!!

We eat here at least 2 or 3 times per month and it's always a treat!!
My new favorite sushi place around! I can't get enough of the ultimate California rolls. Great service and excellent food
Always the best sushi everytime I come! The great thing about it is they are quick as well and don't make you wait long for the food! I always come here!!
Amazing food, awesome cocktails and very friendly staff. Food was fresh and out quick. Will definitely be back. May be my new favorite sushi restaurant!
Amazing sushi here. Great people and amazing employees. Hands down would recommend to any sushi lover
We love Sushi Ave!!!  Nice little place with great Sushi, a good happy hour, and all around good vibe.

I'm a big Sushi fan & not from Gilbert . My best friend Mentioned this place so we tried it . We walked in an the atmosphere and ambiance was amazing ! Farley small , but nice and quiet for one on one conversations.
 The sushi was Great ! I would definitely Recommend this place.

Whoohoo! 100th review on Yelp! 
Sad it's not a five star though. I read reviews. Looked at pictures and was excited to try this place.
We ordered a few apps and sushi rolls from the HH menu and it was all just okay. Chicken wings had a great crispiness and there was a delish garlic sauce just on half
The chicken wing. I wish it came with more sauce. Calamari was disappointing. It was just random cut up sticks that were overcooked and dipping sauce was sour.  Husband enjoyed his shrimp tempura roll and bulgogi. The bulgogi was burnt and had that burnt bitter flavor and came out last. I had the 6 piece sashimi special. Fish was cold but the cuts were a joke. They literally took one normal slice of tuna and cut it in half. The salmon was two whole slices and the "white fish" ended up being red snapper. At least they were whole slices. 
I also had the jalape√±o roll. Which was literally a jalape√±o popper in a sushi roll. It was pretty good surprisingly and had the volcano roll. Presentation was cool because they lit it on fire. 
Service was a bit much. The girl we had was the only
One working until just before we left. She constantly
Kept asking if we were ready to order. But when you give me a book of rolls. It's gonna take time for me to read them. Lol. 
In the end. Food was just okay. Edible. Service was okay. There are just other better places. I guess a plus is they offer a large happy hour menu compared to others.
Best sushi in Gilbert and best happy hour specials.  Our favorite for sushi date night.

Well deserved 4 stars.  Came around 4:30 during happy hour.  Quite and nice atmosphere and happy hour prices were fair.

We ordered tempura veggies and jalape√±o poppers to get started.  They were good, poppers weren't to hot for those who don't like them too spicy but the flavor was really good.

We ordered the double spicy, New Yorker, Las Vegas, crazy lobster and ultimate California rolls and an order of orange chicken. The rolls were all good and are fair size rolls.  I'm not a huge orange chicken fan but everyone else were.  I tried a bite and it was good, I could have eaten an order of it and enjoyed it.

I'll be back!

A bit out of the way coming all the from Gilbert but was in the area, planning on returning, wprth the drive. Rice was slightly undercooked on sushi but am gonna assume that was a fluke. The bulgogi and Katsu were great.

Best sushi in Gilbert. The PHX roll is my favorite. Nana and Harry always provide great sushi at great prices. Its a nice place that isn't loud and pretentious like other chain sushi places....

And their dumplings are to die for.
great sushi, great prices especially lunch happy hour. love the dynamite roll! you'll know why it's called that when they serve it at your table!

Best Sushi East of Los Angeles: Being a Los Angeles native, and an avid sushi eater for over 17years, I figured that by moving by to the desert I would have to settle for mediocre sushi. I was wrong. Sushi Ave. is on par, if not better in some ways (price, friendliness), with the best sushi bars in Los Angeles. Sushi Chef James serves up a wonderful array of house specials and traditional sushi dishes that will have you hooked. Highly Recommended!

This is a excellent place.  I just went last night for Happy hour.  The happy hour menu was excellent.  The place must be a hidden gem very few patrons.   I think people are missing out best sushi place ever!  Excellent service and I will be returning!  Try the Pink lady, Tootsie roll, Ultimate CA roll and Las Vegas roll.  If you like dessert try the mouchi ice cream.

I tried this place on a whim last week because it's pretty close to my house.. It was so good at lunch that we ordered take out for dinner that same day! The waitress was very attentive, and the food was amazing... Officially my favorite sushi restaurant in the valley- and I've tried a lot!

Terrible customer service. Take forever to bring back your check. The lady that runs the place is the rudest human being I have ever dealt with, from any restaurant establishment. Avoid this place at all costs. Their food is barely alright. We used to go all the time because it was cheap but it is no longer worth it.
Great sushi! It was my first time here and the meal was spectacular. The service was great and quick. The atmosphere was very comfortable and the music was lit. 10/10 would do it again.

So Kampai changed hands again.  Not surprising if you read my previous review...  The new Sushi Ave appears to be much better, though not as good as Kampai.  The menu has changed for the better.  They have fresh wasabi available for a small charge.  Perhaps the most interesting change are the infused sake jars that look like science experiments.  I stopped in for a quick lunch.  The service was excellent.  The sushi was decent.  I might just come back again.
Favorite sushi place in Phoenix! Amazing happy hour sushi, and fast and friendly service!

Good sushi, good variety of things. Spicy tuna, and spicy tuna tempura are very good.


The bench outside makes no sense. Auto parts right next door.

I love this place! Their happy hour is amazing! I have been coming here once a month for over a year now and it's turned into a fun and great tradition for my girls and I. I recommend this place to everyone I know for the best sushi

Under new ownership/staffing now and the quality of the food has declined dramatically. 

A real shame, it was a great old north valley resto.

Stopped by here for dinner before seeing a movie down the street.  I got the teriyaki chicken dinner, which comes with miso soup and salad.  Everything was very good and the price was great, I'll be back for sure.  Even though I didn't order sushi, I overheard the waitress explaining some of the rolls to the table next to me, and she really knew what she was talking about.
This place was really great! The staff was super friendly and the sushi was phenomenal, the prices were also very good!

I used to love this place but have read on here that it is under new management. The are smaller and it does not taste anywhere how the rolls used to taste. They were so good but now they are horrible!  Service is great and only reason giving it two stars. Not going back!!

I chose the Double Spicy Roll & Ultimate Dragon Roll.  Amazing!!!  You pay what is normal for great sushi.  When it's this good, I do not care what it costs.  They have lunch sushi specials and Happy Hour sushi specials for those who want to save some dough.  The owners are very nice.  I will be going back again, and again.

This place changed owners a couple of years ago. I went a couple of times after the owner change. The decor changed a little. Service was friendly but honestly everything was not nearly as good. I was pretty disappointed. Rice was too warm, rolls were falling apart & not the same, sashimi was not that good. I never came back. Oh well, it was great while it lasted.
I have been to Sushi Ave a few times and it's okay! It's not amazing sushi or anything special, but it is close by and convenient!

Really enjoyed all of the rolls we tasted. Sushi was as great. It always make me sad the are only coke. :(. We had the Vegas, rolling tiger(yummy), spicy yellowtail, red lobster, ( this was our fav) dragon, baked scallop(this was our least fav) the tempura was very light and good. Thanks for a great meal sushi ave.

As I moved the delectable sushi closer and closer to my tongue and mouth, the aroma that wafted into my nostrils took me on a journey to heaven and back. It wasn't until I tasted the sushi that I knew what true heaven tasted like. My taste buds greeted the spicy tuna roll with open arms and embraced the wasabi that accompanied it. Was it the best sushi I've ever had? Yes, and I'll tell you why. The flavor was to perfection, accompanied with the atmosphere and ambience. Yum yum yum yum yum!!!!!! I highly recommend this place to anyone in the area. It was so delicious and tasty I loved it. Great workers and awesome service.

Very good! Everything was so delicious the ultimate shrimp roll , The loudmouth role, and the Tiger roll everything !!! The udon soup is especially delicious and the wings are to die for!!! I don't think you can order anything that's not good
Love this local place! They have such a variety of both traditional & unique rolls that are delicious & fresh!!!

I was famished when I arrived at this restaurant.  I ordered an appetizer to get food in my stomach as soon as humanly possible.  It ended up coming out after my dinner.  I wouldn't have ordered an appetizer if I had known that would happen. The waitress was prompt, friendly, and helpful.  The food was really good,  and the pricing was very reasonable.
Absolutely delicious... best sushi in East Valley! So fresh and seriously would definitely recommend to come here!
Crazy Lobster Roll is best ever. Seriously. Food is awesome but Lobster Roll is the best. Great prices for the quality of food.

I came in to grab a quick bite by myself, The hostess who also was my server was very sweet when I first walked in. I was the only one in the entire restaurant which made it kind of weird but peaceful at the same time. She asked me if I've been in before and I said no, she asked me if I had any questions about anything which I did not because I'm totally obsess with sushi. I ended up ordering two rolls and the gyozas (dumplings) the food came out quick, fresh, and was absolutely delicious. She even remembered to grab me my Sriracha :) I had an overall good experience and will forsure be back. My roommate also had the teriyaki chicken Togo and he love it!

I'm not gonna lie the food here is good I have no problem with the food. The service is just way too slow. It's not even that they are bad it's just that it takes forever to get your food. The people are nice, but they def need some more servers or something. I wish that the food didn't take so long because it was actually pretty good.

The first time I went to Sushi Ave, probably over a year ago now, the food was decent but the service, while polite, was very slow. Today, though, things are much different. First of all, the food has gone from decent to flippin' AWESOME! Can you say flavor? You might get bigger pieces of fish at other places, but the sushi here is excellently chilled (warm raw sushi freaks me out a little) and full of flavor. Unlike many sushi places in the Mesa area, they really have an excellent flavor to their rice, so you end up enjoying it rather than viewing it as filler to go with your fish. 

And that is as far as the food goes. THe service here has improved greatly, too - plus, the staff are super friendly, so if things do get a little slow, all you have to do is flag the waitress down and check on your order. That doesn't happen often, though - no more than the average business. The decor of the place has also improved - so, yeah, that might be a little silly, but the ambience of a place does make a great difference. My first time there, it was just green walls, black tables, no frills, nothing. And if you went into the bathroom, you were blinded by this hiddeous flourescent orange color that blinded you. Bathroom has been redone, they have adorable lanterns and parisols up on the walls overall, a great little place.

My only word of caution is that the place honestly isn't that big. They do have a large table they set up and separate from the room with a screen if you have a bigger group, but if you have more than eight people.... it might be a tad crowded. This place is slighly on the cozy side. Not bad , though.

Go for the Chirashi bowl!! it's delicious!! As are the Hawaiian roll and the volcano!

I have been meaning to officially get on Yelp for over a year now, my wife and I love trying out new places. It must mean something that I am finally placing a review after eating at Sushi Ave. 

I can't understand how anyone gives this place 5 stars. 3? Maybe. 5? No way. I mean, are so many people falling into the management's plan: place an incredibly generic sushi restaurant in the middle of a residential area and hope that our uninitiated taste buds actually enjoy this bland food. Yep, looks like they have some takers. 

First of all, their windows look like they gave children window paint and let them go to town. Apparently there are 3 different happy hours. After entering and taking a look at the happy hours posted I realized that at 2:00 P.M. on a Friday I just missed the cut. The waitress (owner?) yanked the menu out of my hand and sat me down with a tall glass of water. 

I was literally the only patron in there. There was a Japanese man in the back talking loudly on the phone, March Madness was on tv with subtitles and there was Japanese rock music blaring. 

I decided I would delay judgement on price until after my meal. 

I order a lunch combo for $10.95. Their rolls have 8 pieces each and compared to prices for single orders of some of their rolls, two rolls for 11 bucks wasn't a terrible deal. Well, it was. I was immediately brought a very bland batch of miso soup. The "garden salad" was a small handful of bagged salad with carrot strips thrown into a tiny bowl and drenched in dressing. The rolls were brought out in about 2 minutes, obviously not fresh. I ordered the California Roll and the Spicy Tuna Roll. They tasted exactly the same. I honestly couldn't tell which was which and they were both very bland. Their ginger was honestly the best part. Their wasabi? Mild and not fresh. Their ginger and wasabi are served in medium sized bowls where surely cross-contamination occurs between patrons. The chopsticks are metal, kinda cheap. 

I started this review with a 2 star rating in mind, as I am finishing it I am giving it a 1 star. Meal came out to about $12.00 and I would have only felt comfortable spending $6 for what I received. This place is a joke. 

Management is nice and the Air conditioning works, those are the only positives.

Great experience. We used to love Kampai and had been going there for years.  Then one day a year or so ago we went in and things seemed "different" . Atmosphere was poor, fishy smell and the fish quality was off. The wife and I agreed something had changed for the worse. After getting home I consulted Yelp and lo and behold there were a bunch of reviews talking about how the ownership had changed and the place had really slipped. So time goes by and tonight we decided to give Sushi Ave another chance. Wow are we glad we did! Whatever problems they had are fixed and I honestly can say the place is now better than kampai ever was. Kim Chi, soshito peppers, yellowtail scallion roll, cured salmon and Hamachi Kaman. All wonderful. Give Sushi Ave a try you won't be disappointed .
